 **About Our Awesome Company:**

We believe in 'gene-ius' skincare that's clinically proven and a pleasure to

plus our sensory expertise to formulate results-driven, luxurious skincare
products and professional treatments that make you look and feel amazing.

Our company is rapidly growing in both the Direct to Consumer (DTC) and
Professional channels. As a result, we are investing heavily in ecommerce and
searching for high potential teammates to join our dynamic brand and grow with

We are looking for an outstanding WordPress Web Developer to be responsible
for the coding, design and layout for client websites. Web developer
responsibilities also include managing a support ticket queue and managing
website security updates. Must enjoy working with a creative team and be
proactive in creative problem solving.

 **Responsibilities**

  *  **Assist Lead Web Developer with design or programming tasks as needed.** This could include the following: Help with designing or building of WordPress websites / landing pages, building custom WordPress themes, creating/troubleshooting custom PHP scripts. Creating website layout/user interfaces with HTML/CSS/PHP best practices. Integrating data from various back-end services and databases. Gather and refine specifications and requirements based on technical needs. Create and maintain client training documents and lead client training sessions. Test, trouble shoot, and be proactive in problem solving web solutions. Collaborate and communicate with all team members on a variety of web or digital marketing projects.
  *  **Manage Ticket Support Queue.** Will be responsible for monitoring and responding to client support requests as they come in. Types of requests could include website updates, website support, email support, or questions about new projects. Some requests will be related to social media, graphic design, or more advanced web projects - you will be responsible for making sure that information is forwarded to the appropriate person for follow-up.

  *  **Perform Security Updates.** Will be responsible for monitoring and applying WordPress core and plugin updates to approximately 100 websites, on a frequent basis. This process involves testing after updates have been applied, checking for broken links or errors, and performing site health scans for page speed, best practices, and accessibility on a regular basis. Identifying and reporting to team any bugs or possible issues.

 **Requirements**

  * At least 3 years proven work experience in WordPress Website programming, preferably in an agency setting
  * Ability to work and thrive in a fast-paced environment, juggle multiple tasks within the constraints of timelines and budgets
  * Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written and the ability to communicate with a variety of personalities.
  * Ability to efficiently work with HTML, CSS3, JavaScript/jQuery, SASS, PHP, and MySQL
  * Experience with front end web design and development (experience with backend development a plus, but not required)

  * Basic understanding of web hosting and DNS management

  * Basic understanding of email hosting and management (esp. GSuite)
  * Basic understanding of using SSH to perform simple tasks (such as installing NPM packages or compiling SASS)
  * Be proficient in using Adobe software, especially Photoshop and Illustrator
  * Understanding of best practices and standards for web usability and optimization

  * Ability to troubleshoot website issues/errors and detail follow up until problem is solved
  * Basic understanding of best practices for SEO and accessibility standards

### **About TherapyNotes**

TherapyNotes is the national leader in web-based behavioral health practice
management and electronic health records software for private practices,
psychologists, therapists, counselors, social workers and psychiatrists. Our
software-as-a-service solution integrates patient scheduling, medical records,
billing and electronic claims to streamline the way mental health
professionals manage their practice.

TherapyNotes offers careers that provide you with the freedom to do amazing
work, interact with great people, and offer fantastic learning and growth
opportunities. Our team empowers and challenges each other to learn and solve
complex problems. We are heavily invested in our co-ops and interns and
believe that your experience should be a rewarding one. We provide mentorship
from day one and access to several other professionals who are more than happy
to help you learn. If you are looking to join a supportive team, obtain real-
world experience in your field, and build great products, please submit your
co-op application.

Our growing team is located remotely and on-site at our 30,000 square foot
corporate headquarters in Horsham, PA!

###  **  
Position Description** **  
**

We're looking for a candidate eager for an opportunity to work in a highly
collaborative, fast-paced, Agile environment with teammates focused on
delivering timely, working software that delivers business value and helps our
company to grow.

Our team will mold responsibilities based on your performance, so you could be
tasked with assignments or projects that are at a comparable level of
difficulty to those that our developers are responsible for. Some of the
essential duties and responsibilities include:

  * Full-stack development including application, database, and front end layers
  * Web application development and code review utilizing modern web technologies including ASP.NET, C#, AJAX, SQL, etc.
  * Full development life cycle from planning through successful release and support.

  

  

### **What We're Passionate About**

  * Clean code
  * Being Agile
  * SOLID principles
  * DevOps Culture
  * The best idea wins
  * Most of all, we're passionate about delivering awesome software that our customers love

**Requirements**

  * Experience in some or all of the following technologies: C# (or other object-oriented programming language such as Java, Ruby, or C++), JavaScript, CSS, HTML, SQL, ASP.NET, Ruby on Rails, or PHP.
  * Excellent communication skills, problem solving skills, attention to detail, and strong knowledge of version control and object-oriented concepts.
  * Have a passion for working in a collaborative, entrepreneurial, team-oriented Agile environment.
  * Experience working with a relational databases is a plus.

  

  

TherapyNotes, LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All candidates
whom have been given a conditional offer of employment with TherapyNotes, LLC
must also undergo a criminal background check.

 **JOB TITLE: Web Developer**

 **REPORTS TO: Manager, Data and Development LOCATION: Oklahoma City, OK**

CFS Brands is seeking to hire a Web Developer to work closely with business
unit leaders and other subject matter experts from across the organization,
project managers, and other members of the IT Department to design, develop,
test, refine, and implement systems that deliver business value across a wide
range of subject areas. Modifying and maintaining existing sites and tools
platforms will be elements of this position. The ideal candidate will possess
both strong technical and interpersonal skills, the creativity to design
solutions with minimal guidance, and the discipline to meet project timelines.

 **KEY RESULT AREAS**

· Provide technical thought leadership and be a strong collaborator with
subject matter experts, project managers, and functional leaders

· Apply in-depth technical knowledge to develop applications across one or
more technology areas, such as web applications, REST and SOAP APIs, web
services and application database integrations

· Plan, design, develop, test, debug, and deploy highly available applications

· Document key SDLC processes by producing formal documents like solution
architecture documents and technical system design specifications, etc.

· Perform code analysis, requirements analysis, software review,
identification of code metrics, system risk analysis, and software reliability
analysis

· Participate in troubleshooting complex issues and resolving defects

· Participate in prioritization of major projects based on business needs,
budget, and risk reduction

· Review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and
develop strategies for improvement

· Provide verbal and written communication and education to end users for all
modified and new systems

· Maintain compliance with all company policies and procedures

· Other duties as assigned

 **EDUCATION**

· Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field

· 2 additional years’ experience may be combined with an Associate Degree

· 5 additional years’ experience may be substituted for no related degree

 **REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS**

· 3 years’ experience developing software with PHP

· 3 years’ experience using object-oriented programming patterns

· 3 years’ experience working with Git version control

· Advanced skill in analyzing and understanding business / technology system
architectures, databases, and client applications

· Ability to work and communicate effectively with other technical personnel
as well as functional users at all organizational levels

· Ability to forecast level of effort for development work, track progress and
prioritize remaining work

· Experience with Agile or Lean project management methodologies

· Willingness and ability to work extended hours when necessary to meet
project timelines

 **DESIRED** **SKILLS AND ABILITIES**

· Experience with major business systems such as ERP systems, CRM systems,
warehouse management systems, and manufacturing / shop floor systems

· Experience with Drupal

· Experience with web content management systems

· Experience with client- and server-side frameworks (e.g., Angular and
NodeJS)

· Experience with C# .NET (highly desired), Java, Python, or R

 **TRAVEL REQUIRED**

· Up to10% travel in support of multiple corporate initiatives

**What's the opportunity?**

This is a full time position.

You'll be working on architecture entering mission critical applications in
manufacturing and utilities around the world.

Engineering at Dispel is not just a technical experience—it's a social one. We
are a growing, but still small team in which every person participates.
Solving problems and improving code/infrastructure is fun. This is a journey,
and we want it to be rewarding.

You would be working on the Web Console and API product which our clients use
to manage infrastructure and people that need access to their critical
systems. The frontend is a React single page app and the backend is an Express
API.

We are a small but competent engineering team, and you will be expected to
make a big impact and share / learn a lot.

 **  
Location**

Texas and New York, United States. We are fully remote during pandemic but are
planning to open an office or co-working space in Austin after pandemic is
over. Our office in Brooklyn, New York is currently open. This job is probably
not fully remote forever, it will be "half remote".

 **  
Stack includes**

Node, React, Express, Webpack, React-Router, Storybook, Jest, Mocha,
PostgreSQL, Redis, Heroku, Swagger

 **Requirements**

 **Basic Qualifications** ‌

  * Excellent HTML, CSS and JS skills.
  * 5+ years of experience.
  * Comfortable with modern web development landscape.
  * Have experience working with React.
  * Must have been deeply involved with at least one API, preferably one that is un-opinionated such as Express, Koa or Flask.
  * Fast learner. Degrees and certificates aren’t a determining factor for us. Rather, we value your ability to care about your work and learn fast.
  * Communication and team culture are very important to Dispel. These criteria are soft, but just relax and be genuine.

**Extra Credit**

  * Working on an advanced web stack that was based around React.
  * Unit and integration testing of websites and APIs.
  * Storybook experience.

**Good Personal Traits**

  * A willingness to accept failure and feedback, learn and try again.
  * A passion for learning new disciplines and gaining a deep understanding of how others on the team do their work.
  * An ability to communicate clearly and succinctly both in-person and over team chat.

**Benefits**

  * Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
  * Retirement Plan (401k)
  * Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
  * Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
  * Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)
  * Short Term & Long Term Disability

**Title:** _ Lead Web Developer_  
 **Reports To:** Sr. _Director, Software Development_  
 **Department:** _Information Technology (IT)_  
 **Location:** _Remote_  
Position Summary  
Education _Dynamics_ is a marketing and enrollment management services and
technology company dedicated to connecting students with the right school for
them. We are higher education experts and full-funnel marketers who live and
breathe data, optimization, and results.

The Lead Web Developer guides the web development process for our diverse set
of client websites and landing pages in our Enrollment Management marketing
services division. We are seeking an experienced leader, dynamic problem
solver, strong communicator, and self-motivated individual to join our team as
the technical subject matter expert and owner of the creation, enhancement,
and maintenance of our growing suite of digital marketing focused client
websites. This position reports to the Senior Director of Software
Development.  
Primary Responsibilities

  * Hands on front-end web development for responsive websites running on WordPress CMS, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript and PHP.
  * Manage a small team of web developers by triaging tasks, assigning them to an appropriate resource, maintaining development and deployment schedules in collaboration with business stakeholders and project management.
  * Maintain development infrastructure and processes including Git source control, code promotion and production deployment.
  * Provide leadership, mentoring and guidance to the web development team. Strive to maintain high morale and pride in work and accomplishments, advocate for providing well designed solutions. Motivate and empower the team to make a difference in the business outcomes.
  * Keep in touch with current web development best practices, tools, and frameworks, and be proactive in strategically bringing those emerging trends to our sites.
  * Interact with clients directly to help gather requirements for new site implementations and to exchange ideas on site redesigns and major feature releases.
  * Work with business stakeholders to analyze and troubleshoot issues and process breakdowns.
  * Work with technical decisions makers to suggest and help implement architecture and process improvements.

Required Skills & Experience

  * 5+ years’ experience in web development, at least 1 year of experience in a leadership role.
  * Strong knowledge and extensive experience in CSS, HTML, JavaScript.
  * Understanding of developing responsive websites built for high traffic digital marketing experiences.
  * Demonstrated leadership qualities managing an internal team and effectively working with business stakeholders.
  * Experience with Git source control.
  * Experience with creating, maintaining, and enhancing websites running on WordPress CMS platform.
  * Experience developing with PHP in a WordPress environment, including custom themes and plugins.
  * Strong understanding of website performance and Core Web Vitals (CWV).
  * Experience working with databases and SQL queries.
  * Drupal and .Net experience a plus.
  * Enjoy working in a positive and team-oriented environment that rewards “working smart” and praises effective collaboration.

Education

  * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Web Design (or another related field) or equivalent experience.

**We’re Spindle (a division of Dober) – It’s Nice to Meet You!**

We are passionate people with soulful dedication to making our world a better,
cleaner place through exceptional chemistry and brilliant technology. For over
60 years, Dober has delivered innovative chemistry and software solutions to
solve our customers’ most challenging problems.

Our entrepreneurial spirit, and belief that _none of us is as smart as all of
us,_ helps us challenge the status quo of current industry norms. We believe
water can be treated naturally, equipment can be cleaned safely, and
operations can be run more efficiently. Our founder’s vision that
_“Development is the heartbeat of this company”_ lives on today.

Speaking of development and innovation, one of our key product lines is
Spindle – the product line this position will be supporting and working
within. Spindle is a technology company that builds the infrastructure for
industrial operations to measure and improve their performance. Businesses of
every size – from startups to public companies – use our software to collect
data and manage their industrial operations more efficiently.

www.SpindleLive.com

 **Our People:**

Our success is built on an intimate foundation between our employees, partners
and customers. We know that if we can connect and engage the minds and hearts
of our employees to our vision & values—results and happy customers will
follow. We accomplish this by living our core values every day and creating a
destination for your career and craft.

 **The values that guide us:**

You won’t find our core values stuffed in a drawer. We believe in our core
values so much that they’re painted all over our walls. To ensure
compatibility, we do a deep dive on one’s core values when we’re hiring or
developing a new partnership. The right candidate will demonstrate and share
our core values through and through:

  *  **AMAZE OUR CUSTOMERS**
  *  **COURAGE TO CREATE**
  *  **PROMOTE TEAM SUCCESS**
  *  **OPEN MINDED TO CHANGE**
  *  **DO THE RIGHT THING**
  *  **MUTUAL TRUST AND RESPECT FOR ONE ANOTHER**
  *  **POSITIVE MENTAL ATTITUDE (PMA)**

 **The Opportunity:**

Creativity, development, and innovation is the heartbeat of Dober, and we are
seeking a strong **Web Application Developer for our Spindle Team**. Spindle
is a technology company that builds the infrastructure for industrial
operations to measure and improve their productivity. Businesses of every size
from startups to public companies – use our software to collect data and
manage their industrial operations more efficiently.

 **Position Summary:**

We welcome all Web Application Developer candidates for an opportunity to be
part of our innovative and dynamic agile application development team. The
Spindle Applications Development Team is responsible for developing and
maintaining multiple platforms for our SpindleLIVE SaaS operations management
application suite of products. This role will be responsible for developing
and maintaining web applications. The successful candidate must have the
ability to clearly communicate and collaborate within a team across functional
areas in a remote environment. They must also take pride in writing clean,
readable, reusable, and semantic code.

 **Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

  * Translate our Spindle Product Management Team and customer requirements into functional, appealing, and interactive applications.
  * Ability to work in a dynamic agile application development environment.
  * Build rapport and communicate with Spindle Product Management Team to provide evaluation of business requirements and feature requests to determine technical requirements and goals to arrive at proposed technical solutions - all within an agile methodology working pattern.
  * Utilize strong organizational, analytical, and execution skills, including a high degree of accuracy and exactness in performing development tasks.
  * Self-sufficient, requires minimal direct supervision, and mentors/coaches others junior members on the team.
  * Work closely and cohesively with user experience team members to execute projects within development release cycle process.
  * Providing innovative ideas and methods of improving our development methodology and stack.
  * Ability to encourage and enforce development of best practice and processes with project team members.
  * Improve the user-experience by applying best practices and industry trends currently in the marketplace.
  * Adheres to best practice cloud architecture and development standards.
  * Complete comprehensive unit testing on all developed/enhanced software.
  * Proactively identifies opportunities to improve user satisfaction.
  * Provide on call development support in the event of critical run-time issues of web applications.
  * Perform code reviews with other developers to ensure conformance with coding and security standards.

 **Qualifications:**

  * 4+ years of progressively responsible experience in web application development and design
  * Proven experience building complex front end web applications with a high degree of user interactivity utilizing JavaScript with HTML and CSS is critical.
  * Development experience with ASP.NET, C#, Web API, Rest, React, and Vue.js is highly desired
  * Experience with database constructs in MS SQL, MySQL is also highly desired.
  * Excellent written & verbal communication skills, and tight team collaboration approach required.

 **The Process: What to Expect**

 **Y** ou find or get this job ad and it piques your interest

You apply – which lets us know you’re interested. **_Yay!_** You will answer a
few screening questions to ensure you meet the basic qualifications of the
role.

A member of our People Development & Human Experience team will reach out to
establish initial contact to tell you a bit more about the role, Dober and the
interview process.

We dig a bit deeper and establish initial connection with the hiring manager
for the role.

You come and meet the team, and you leave energized and excited.

 **Benefits & Perks**

 **Core Benefit Program:** From Retirement to Health Benefits, we got you
covered. Participate in Dober’s 401k Employee Savings Plan select from
multiple Health Insurance Plans to fit your need

 **Paid Leave:** These moments are special. We want you to enjoy them without
the worry of work.

 **Rewards & Recognition: ** We believe you can never over recognize good
work. That is why we celebrate a monthly ‘Hedgehog of the Month’ winner, a
Quarterly ‘Innovator’ winner, and an annual ‘Mr. D’ winner. You’re doing
important work here, we know it, and we will celebrate it.

 **Casual Dress Code:** When required to visit corporate office or other Dober
facilities we want you to come to work and be comfortable. Jeans are
encouraged, your favorite (Chicago) sports shirts are welcomed, and we love
employees with good ‘sock game’. Your slacks and sport coats may collect dust,
but we’re okay with that if you are.

dietary supplements based on traditional Chinese medicine. We uncover nature's
healing power and help people live active life. Our products are of premium
quality and remarkably effective, safe, yet affordable. We have now opened a
web developer position to enhance our eCommerce web sites. This is a great
opportunity for future career growth.

This is a full time salaried position. The job needs to be on site. No
independent contractors, please.

Job Description **:**

You will implement technical solutions to enhance the performance of our
current eCommerce web sites by improving customer experience and conversion
and thus drive sales growth.

Specific responsibilities include:

  * Develop and improve web site functionalities to facilitate online shopping experience through custom programming and installing third party API solutions.

For example, we developed a reward program that would integrate and value
customers’ experience of shopping, review writing, and referral together.

  * Work closely with internal teams to ensure development of sites and applications meet business needs and standards.
  * Maintain the current web sites for smooth functionalities.
  * Build web sites from scratch.
  * Know and be able to work with networks, linux servers etc.

Qualifications:

  * 3 years+ solid experience in web site development using HTML, CSS, Javascript, JSON and Ajax.
  * 3 years+ solid experience with MySQL and PHP (PHP frameworks like Laravel is a plus)
  * Familiarity with responsive design.
  * Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent degree.
  * Be able to learn new programming/scripting languages.
  * Version control (Git etc.)
  * Previous experience with e-commerce desirable.

We are seeking a talented individual to join our team as a Lead Web Developer.

Netkinetix Inc.

 **Experienced Web Developer/Programmer**  
Are you self-motivated and ready to tackle the next big project? Be part of a
team of engineers and developers that are leaders in the industry, building
innovative custom software, helping our customers succeed and reach their
business goals.

We are looking for a Web Developer to create innovative software solutions for
business, government, and industry. You will provide a lead role in building
custom business software including complex website applications, custom
integrations and mobile applications. In this role, you will provide design
services that help our customers market, manage, and expand their operations
by giving them constant access to fast and flexible tools and resources
pertinent to their businesses and operation. You will be expected lead design
efforts and provide architectural direction throughout the entire software
development life cycle in an agile environment. Working as a team with your
peers, collaborating on architecture and mentoring teammates will be a daily
requirement. A strong work ethic and strong personal accountability will
position you for success.

 **About the Company**  
Netkinetix is a leading custom software development company located in the
scenic Driftless Region with the Mississippi River on the west and scenic
bluffs to the east. Our newly renovated office is conveniently located between
Onalaska and Holmen, just minutes away from the City of La Crosse. We serve
customers nationally in both the public and private sectors. With more than 20
years in the industry, our main focus is building software that keeps
businesses moving forward and ahead of their competition. Our in-house staff
of seasoned software developers are well versed in all major development
platforms.

Netkinetix foundation and culture is built upon the following core values:

  * Communication
  * Adaptability
  * Innovation
  * Reliability
  * Integrity
  * Value

If these values resonate with you then our company might be a good fit.  
 **Why Should You Apply?**

  * Competitive salary
  * Great team atmosphere
  * 5-day work week
  * Excellent benefits including medical, vision, and dental
  * IRA contributions
  * PTO

 **The Position**

  * Work on-site in our office with cross-functional teams, including a team of programmers in an Agile environment
  * Conceptualize and generate great ideas
  * Code daily with clean, effective code that meets design specifications, and is maintainable
  * Act as Lead developer on projects, guiding other developers around software design, technology choice and coding best practices
  * Collaborate with members of a team (Product Owners, Business Analysts, and other programmers) to ensure application requirements are met
  * Troubleshoot and solve code problems quickly and efficiently
  * Stay current with industry standard tools and technologies

  * Meet or beat deadlines

 **Qualifications**

  * Professional with excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  * Some development experience preferably with .NET, MVC, C#, HTML 5, CSS, JavaScript, JQuery, SQL Server, Visual Studio, Jira, Entity Framework
  * Efficient analytical and problem-solving skills
  * Energetic self-starter able to learn new skills rapidly

  * Natural passion for detail and integrity with a curiosity to lead, learn, and grow
  * An enthusiastic team player, excellent communicator and passionate problem solver
  * Ability to see the big picture and help guide and inspire others
  * Ability to think ahead in order to prioritize and plan activities taking into account all the relevant issues and factors such as deadlines, resources and cross-project dependencies.

 **About Volano Software**

Volano is made up of smart, friendly, creative people who treat each other

As a full stack web developer, you will be responsible for the front and back
end of the Rio Grande ecommerce website as well as all our internal
applications. You will work with a talented group of business analysts,
program managers, system administrators, marketing team members, other
developers, and our QA team to build the solution our customers need. For this
role we are looking for a self-motivated candidate that embraces change,
enjoys being challenged and that finds passion for the perfect mix of front
and back end.

 **What You'll Do:**

· Maintain, modify, develop and architect client-side code for Rio Grande’s
website and internal web applications, using HTML, CSS, CSS Preprocessors
(SASS), CSS frameworks (Bootstrap), AJAX, JavaScript, JavaScript frameworks
(jQuery, Knockout.js).  
· Maintain, modify, develop and architect server-side code for our ecommerce
platforms and internal applications, using C#, SQL, LINQ.  
· Build REST and SOAP APIs between our B2B platform and different end points
(enterprise software, databases, email service provider, UPS).  
· Develop and troubleshoot SSIS packages, data routines, SQL jobs and batch
files to maintain the data flow of our web platform.  
· Troubleshoot, test and maintain the core product software and databases to
ensure strong security, performance, optimization and functionality.  
· Stay current on and implement secure coding practices.  
· Help develop and document development activities in the Coding Standards
Document.  
· Collaborate with both offshore and onshore teams to develop features in
tandem for our website or internal apps as well as to give guidance as the Rio
Grande SME to these teams.  
· Work with different teams on specific projects to implement or integrate new
technologies or services (search engine, tax services, etc.).  
· Ability to work both individually and as part of a team depending on the
requirements of the project.  
· Review others’ code to ensure delivery of high-quality functionality and
participate in an environment of learning.  
· Facilitate conversations around technical decisions and architecture.  
· Mentor others regarding policies, practices and procedures, including
reviewing work (code, documentation).

 **What You'll Need:**

· 5 years of professional work experience developing ecommerce web
applications.  
· 5 year of hands-on coding experience with ASP.Net,.Net Core C#, MVC,
JavaScript, jQuery,Vue.js, CSS, HTML, XML, AJAX, SQL.  
· 1 year of hands on experience in DevSecOps tools with building and managing
CI/CD pipelines in cloud environment.

Technology, Management Information Systems or equivalent experience preferred.

· Solid understanding of web application architecture & operations.  
· Experience working with the Agile methodology.  
· Experience using ticket/issue tracking (TFS, Jira, etc.).  
· Familiarity with versioning control tools (Git, TFS, Azure DevOps).

Marketing Platforms (Optimizely) is a plus.  
· Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills.  
· Strong attention to detail.

Our story

The Post and Courier: Founded in 1803, The Post and Courier is the oldest
newspaper in the South, the second oldest in the United States and the largest
in South Carolina with more than 90 journalists on staff. With many honors and
accolades to its credit, the newspaper has garnered the highest awards in
journalism often besting much larger media conglomerates including two
Pulitzer Prizes. In 2021, The Post and Courier split from its parent company
and along with the community papers formed Evening Post Publishing Newspaper
Group.

In addition to The Post and Courier in Charleston, S.C., the newspaper is
represented by:

The Post and Courier Greenville The Post and Courier Spartanburg

The Post and Courier Columbia The Post and Courier Myrtle Beach

The Post and Courier North Augusta The Post and Courier Hilton Head.

Evening Post Newspaper Group also publishes:

Aiken Standard – originally established in 1867 and purchased by Evening Post
Publishing, Inc. in 1968, the daily newspaper also publishes the North Augusta
Star .

Summerville Journal Scene – with roots dating back to 1946 the newspaper
focuses on hyper-local community news in Dorchester County and publishes on
Wednesdays.

The Gazette – is freely distributed weekly to more than 11,000 locations in
the cities of Goose Creek and Hanahan with a strong emphasis on local content
written by local writers.

The Berkeley Independent – primarily serves Moncks Corner and surrounding
Berkeley County communities and is published on Wednesdays featuring live
news, business, sports and local reporting. This newspaper has history too
that we might want to mention the year.

Moultrie News – has served the East Cooper community since 1964. The trained
and dedicated professionals of the newspaper work tirelessly to provide
quality informative reporting on local events with knowledge, perspective and
compassion.

Free Times – a progressive, alternative weekly publication covering news,
politics, arts and entertainment in Columbia, S.C., since 1987.

Georgetown Times – with roots dating back to 1798 the newspaper is one of the
oldest weekly newspapers in the U.S., it was purchased in 1973 by Evening Post
Publishing, Inc. and continues to serve the people of Georgetown County with
relevant and engaging community news.

Kingstree News – offers breaking news, crime alerts, sports, weather and
opinion weekly and has served Kingstree and Williamsburg County since 1972.

The Star – Established in 1954 in North Augusta, the weekly newspaper is known
as “the keeper of North Augusta history and champion of things that make the
community a better place to live,” covering local news, business and sports.

Other entities held by Evening Post Publishing Newspaper Group include:

Evening Post Books Founded by Pierre Manigault and John M. Burbage in 2008,
Evening Post Books is the award-winning book publishing division of Evening
Post Newspaper Group based in Charleston, South Carolina. The publisher
specializes in books written by authors hailing from and writing about the
South Carolina Lowcountry, including high-quality fiction, non-fiction, and
specialty publications.

White Oak Forestry – Established in 1984 he forestry manages more than 16,000
acres in the Santee Delta with a focus on timber harvesting and conservation
of the longleaf pine.

South Carolina Event Productions – South Carolina Event Productions creates
and produces a wide variety of events across the state that help cultivate
community, reach new audiences, and create unique experiences for attendees.
With The Post and Courier’s statewide reach, South Carolina Event Productions
also develops extensive marketing plans to help promote the events, highlight
key sponsors and partners, and ultimately increase overall brand awareness,
and revenue.

King & Columbus – a dynamic digital marketing agency that strategically helps
ambitious businesses generate profits by building awareness, driving web
traffic, connecting with customers and growing overall sales.

Our mission is driven by providing quality journalism that is engaging and
valuable to the communities we service.

$2,500 tuition reimbursement

What you will do:

 **POSITION DESCRIPTION** **:**

The Web Developer will work as part of a team to create and support a wide
variety of digital platforms, capabilities, features and functions. Your
primary responsibilities will include providing quality solutions in
conjunction with the manager, other developers, our in-house Marketing team,
and building the front-ends of our web-based, internal tools. The focus of
this position is ongoing development and support of digital site/content
management systems, advertising platforms and business intelligence systems.

 **RESPONSIBILITIES:**

  * Participates in all full lifecycle software development of web applications.

  * Communicates effectively with technical team members as well as content subject matters experts.

  * Ability to learn new software and technologies quickly.

  * Ability to follow instructions and work with other departments to find solutions.

  * Plans, implements, and supports page designs and features in multiple content management systems (CMS).

  * Contribute to the maintenance and update of our corporate websites and online brand presence with additional landing pages, functional upgrades and trackable links.

  * Flexibility/adaptability. Adjusts quickly to changing priorities and conditions. Copes effectively with complexity and change.

Job Description:
Consider joining our growing team at Accessory Power. We manufacture several
brands of consumer electronic tech accessories: GOgroove® | ENHANCE® | ReVIVE®
| USA Gear® along with a handful of other lines and various accessory
products. We’re growing! Become a vital member of our team and our growth.

 **Basic Description:**

The Junior Software Developer, using their skills in advanced problem solving
and technical programming, works as a key part of our growing department and
in cooperation with the Art Department, Operations, and eCommerce teams to aid
in the creation and ongoing development of in-house software and web
applications which improve our growing and evolving business operations. A
successful candidate will be a critical thinker, a professionally kind
collaborator, and proven problem solver who works well in teams and under
pressure with often competing deadlines. This is an opportunity for a junior
programmer to apply their existing .NET C#, SQL/Database, and web development
skills in an Agile, small and entrepenurial team environment.  
  
**Job Responsibilities:**

  

  * Analyze business problems and help to design technical software solutions to those problems.
  * Help to build custom software applications and web applications which may interact with order systems, customer service systems, inventory systems, and/or shipping systems.
  * Help to identify and resolve bugs occurring in software and web applications.
  * Analyze current software solutions and build enhancements to improve those solutions.

**Requirements**

 **Basic Requirements:**

  * Education: BA in Computer Science or related field of study.
  * Verifiable English language and writing skills.
  * A deep desire to resolve complex problems with creative and organized technical solutions.
  * Proficiency with cross-browser HTML and CSS programming, JavaScript, JQuery, MVC, WCF and WebForms.
  * Understanding of Microsoft Windows services, web services, SOAP, or XML file exchange.
  * Deep understanding of Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design.
  * Proficiency working within and manipulating MS SQL, MySQL, or Firebird databases.
  * Must be able to understand and help generate written documentation for software solutions.

  

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**

  * Experience with software collaboration, project management, or other digital organizational tools.
  * GIT experience in code collaboration.
  * Experience building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers.
  * Extremely organized, have an obsessive attention to detail, and a thirst to multi task.
  * Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
  * Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project.
  * Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs.

**Benefits**

During these difficult times, as we ease our way back into the office by

Our staff works hard and plays hard too. During normal non-COVID times, we

If you are hired, we will require you to prove that you have received the

The AAM Group’s Web Developers and Junior Developers are web-based programmers
working in PHP, JavaScript, and React, that are responsible for helping to
build web-based software that is used by our stakeholders. They work alongside
AAM’s team of programmers to help build and develop our next big idea as well
as helping to maintain existing ones.

 **Who We Are**

AAM is the largest program distribution group in the specialty automotive
aftermarket (TheAAMGroup.com). We provide services for customers of our
wholesale distribution members, which collectively operate nearly 60
warehouses across North America. We reach more than 14,000 resellers of many
types, including 4×4 shops, spray-in bedliner shops, camper top shops, speed
shops, machine shops and engine builders, fleet upfitters, and many other
specialized local automotive shops. Our job at headquarters is to facilitate
purchases for our members and provide marketing tools and services to their
resellers to help them be more successful businesses—ultimately driving more
purchases to our members and the suppliers that support us.

Our fastest-growing offering is Aftermarket Websites®
(AftermarketWebsites.com): a website-building service just for retailers and
installers in the specialty automotive aftermarket. Built BY the industry, FOR
the industry, our sites point consumers searching for products to their local
brick-and-mortar options (i.e., the shops you’ll be designing websites for).
This robust, e-commerce–ready platform lets shop owners upload product
information, including pricing, to reach consumers searching for the products
they sell. Aftermarket Websites® currently hosts more than 100 websites, and
we are adding more every month.

We’re on a mission to build the best websites for the best price for our
stores. We are a hardworking, close-knit team, and nobody in the automotive
aftermarket industry does what we do as well as we do it. For more information
about who we are, check out our organization’s most recent presentation book:
TheAAMGroup.com/partners.

**The IDEAL Candidate**

You are highly creative, passionate about web development, detail-oriented,
and can follow directions well. An important part of this position involves
cultivating a deep understanding of our website platforms (don’t worry, we’ll
teach you!) to be able to build and fine-tune our software for the betterment
of our customers. We need good developers that can write clean code, learn
from their mistakes, and understand the best outcomes for our customers to
ensure we keep improving. Programmers can never stop learning. There is always
new technologies and better ways to do something than the last time you did.

Also, because most people in an office environment are not techies or
typically as qualified on computers as most programmers are, from time-to-time
help fix office-related computer problems and help to implement best practices
with IT.

Last, the ideal candidate is fun, respectful, kind, and does their job without
needing to be micro-managed. We don’t want to hover any more than you want us
hovering, but you’ll receive support whenever you need it.

**This is NOT a remote position** —we want the pleasure of your company in the
office!

**Job Duties**

  * Build, develop, and create new software that meets expectations and is delivered on time.

  * Ensure that created software is well tested and functions as intended when used by others.

  * Maintain/update existing tools and software with new features and improvements.

  * Help to maintain AAM’s hardware in the office – Desk computers, laptops, servers, and all other equipment.

  * General Office IT – Work with AAM staff to help manage, install, and update computers throughout the office.

  * Participate in regular code reviews to help you learn and enhance your coding skills.

 **Skill Requirements**

  * Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science

  * Excellent computer skills

  * Basic/Moderate understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript (ES6), React, and PHP

  * Capable of developing Object-Oriented PHP software

  * Firm knowledge of building SQL queries (MySQL) and working with complex database structures

  * Experience with Git Hub/Git

  * Understanding of TypeScript, SCSS, Docker, and Webpack and added plus.

  * Must have experience developing in MVC Framework. CodeIgniter 2/3/4 or Laravel is an added plus.

  * Must be able to gather requirements, build code, and work independently as well as work jointly with the team.

  * Must take pride in paying attention to the details.

  * Must have problem-solving mentality and the ability to weigh the priorities of various work demands.

  * Must be focused and self-motivated.

  * Must have strong verbal & written communication skills

  * Must be able to work from our Piney Flats office. No remote or offsite work offered.

  * Develop wireframes, mockups, and prototypes to effectively present interaction and design ideas in a group setting
  * Utilize advanced CSS, HTML and JavaScript to create cross-browser web applications
  * Participate in regular development team meetings to report on project progress.

  * Review application code to identify and prioritize opportunities for code improvement.
  * Research industry trends to ensure that our standards and practices are current and poised to guide our team to deliver the best website possible.
  * Undertake applicable technical training as needed

  * Three or more years of proven UI/UX design experience with samples available upon request
  * Proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3
  * Proficient understanding of client-side scripting using jQuery and web templating
  * Good understanding of asynchronous event programming, partial page updates, and AJAX
  * Knowledge of web accessibility standards, SEO principles, and cross browser compatibility
  * Ability to work independently with self-direction to complete tasks and projects in a pro-active manner.

  * Strong interest in emerging technologies and a passion for web design and user experience
  * Experience updating and maintaining WordPress websites preferred
  * Experience working with source control/ bug reporting tools, Microsoft Team Foundation Server a plus.
  * Experience with data visualization APIs, charting, graphs, google maps API a plus
  * Experience with mobile development for iOS and Android platforms a plus

 **Education Requirements:**

  * Bachelor's degree or a minimum of 5-6 years of front-end development.

 **Information Security Standards for All AIA Employees:**

  * Are permitted to use information only in performance of their job duties.
  * Are to secure and protect information in their possession.
  * Are to protect workstations, laptops, smart phones, PDAs, portable storage and other devices containing AIA sensitive information.
  * Are responsible for taking annual information security awareness training and other information security educational programs.
  * So that _AIA_ can meet its obligations to secure sensitive information, AIA employees and contractors have no right to privacy on the _AIA_ IT network.
  * AIA employees and contractors who violate these policies or who demonstrate poor judgment in the way they protect sensitive information are subject to disciplinary action, up to and including termination.

to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

**We're bringing back the full stack.**

Advanced Simulation Technology inc. (ASTi) is looking for the one person with
just the right mix of front- and back-end development experience to help
consolidate and modernize our existing web-based tools, and to develop new
apps to improve and streamline our various workflows.

 _This is a full-time position in Herndon, VA for a U.S. citizen or permanent
resident. You should have a Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Computer
Science + 2 years' experience developing web apps. If you don't have a degree,
you'll need 4 years' hands-on industry experience._

We currently have a collection of internal Python apps hosted on a number of
different Linux platforms. At first, you will be responsible for researching
and selecting a single framework (or stack) upon which to unify the
redeployment of these apps. Once approved, you'll have to build and configure
the production server (or VM) for internal systems and in AWS for a few
public-facing apps.

 **That's when the fun really begins.**

You will work with a small team to rehost or refactor some existing
applications (e.g., an online returns authorization or internal shipment
tracking app) to work on this new framework. Further, we would like you to
work with our R&D, Sales, and Production teams to identify new web-based apps
that we could develop to help make their jobs and lives easier. In this
position, your co-workers are your customers, so you should be flexible and
welcome working on projects with multiple iterations as requirements and
features are tweaked and refined.

You should have experience doing this sort of thing with Linux, mostly CentOS
and looking toward Rocky. We are most familiar with Python and Javascript, and
you should have a solid handle on using Git, Bitbucket, Jira, etc.

ASTi started in 1989, and has since become a leader in sound and
communications for the training and simulation industry. We have fewer than 50
employees, and offer some fantastic benefits; just check out our website. ASTi
has made Washingtonian magazine's "50 Great Places to Work" three times.

If you're interested, send your resume to us. In the meantime, check out some
of our benefits: https://www.asti-usa.com/jobs/benefits.html

 **Please Note**

We discovered that Indeed is linking our job ads to a different company in
North Carolina that receives a lot of negative reviews. That's not us. We are
located in the DC metro area, and our company ownership has never changed
hands since 1989. Check out the jobs section of our website: https://www.asti-
usa.com/jobs/

 **WHO WE ARE**  
We are Adaptive, a growing and successful software company with a great
reputation amongst staff and clients alike. We work closely with our financial
clients to build bespoke software solutions to support their business goals.
Our client's success relies on us making sound technical decisions,
collaborating with stakeholders and being up to date with the latest
technology and practices in the Fintech industry.

 **The Role:**  
Our New York office is looking for a senior Web Developer to deliver a next-
generation all-to-all real time trading platform to serve the North American
institutional market. The platform will be delivered in a greenfield manner
with a modern technology stack throughout. This includes a reactive HTML5
front-end and a clustered, resilient back-end. Adaptive has unique experience
delivering similar platforms and the person in this role will be crucial to
leveraging that internal knowledge and driving the delivery directly in
partnership with the client and their senior management.

As a web applications developer, you will:

  * Build greenfield financial applications alongside your Adaptive colleagues
  * Use the latest technology to create elegant and robust solutions
  * Contribute to building and releasing quality software on time
  * Use your knowledge to build great-looking, event-driven and highly interactive interfaces
  * Collaborate with server-side developers, user-experience designers and business analysts
  * Participate in a test-driven, agile environment
  * Keep up to date with the developments in technology and quickly adapt to them to achieve better results

Required skills and experience:

  * Extensive client-side development experience, gained while building single-page web applications
  * Expertise in JavaScript: you understand prototypical inheritance, scope, and closures
  * Proficiency in user-interface technologies in addition to JavaScript, eg HTML5 and CSS3; and in React.js
  * Practical knowledge of web tooling such as Webpack, NPM, Yarn, Gulp and PostCSS
  * Understanding of ES6 and newer ES specifications
  * Proficient with Chrome developer tools, including knowing how to diagnose and fix performance issues
  * Experience of working on front office systems
  * Language: English (fluent)

Desirable skills and experience:

  * Working with distributed teams
  * TypeScript, Rx.js, Redux
  * Event-driven APIs
  * Real time trading experience

Personal qualities:

  * Strong desire to raise the bar for your team technically
  * Tenacious, curious, and collaborative in all aspects of your work
  * A quick learner with excellent communication skills

In return, we offer:  
Benefits:

  * Medical, dental, and vision
  * 23 days vacation
  * LTD/STD
  * 401K where we match contributions up to 5% of base
  * Gym subsidy
  * FLSA
  * Commuter benefits

About Us  
Want to work with clever people, in an environment where neither politics nor
bad habits get in the way of using your talents to deliver great results?  
You have found the right place. We are Adaptive, where you, as part of a team
of highly skilled software delivery experts, will use the latest technology to
design, build and operate bespoke, real-time solutions for Tier 1 investment
banks and commodity trading firms.  
DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION: Diversity and inclusion are key to a great workplace
and Adaptive is better when it’s more representative of the world around us.
Everyone should feel comfortable bringing their whole selves to work at
Adaptive, without any fear of judgment or negativity. All we ask is that our
colleagues are passionate about what they do, have the skills needed to be
successful in the role, and are adaptable and collaborative  
Please note that due to the nature of our work, we will run a background check
on the successful candidate after an offer has been accepted.

the US.

  * Maintain and improve a variety of web and mobile (hybrid) applications utilizing a variety of technologies with our agile-like approach
  * Curate project backlog and present iteration planning to the client
  * Release updates to staging and production environments through Azure DevOps

 **About Volano Software**

Volano is made up of smart, friendly, creative people who treat each other
like family and who work together to deliver quality custom software to our
clients. We love to be challenged. But we ensure our team members also feel
supported. And we balance getting our work done with not taking ourselves too
seriously.

Volano core values:

  * Learn Constantly
  * Perform to Completion
  * Take Pride in Our Work
  * Adapt Easily
  * Be Fun

 **Benefits and Perks**

We want to make sure we can provide the perks that will make you happy.
Starting with the latest equipment, we want to provide a flexible environment
that makes you the most efficient and effective developer possible. We provide
3 weeks of paid time off and want you to take it – there's nothing that will
kill a good attitude quicker than getting burnt out. We offer a group health
insurance plan through Blue Cross & Blue Shield and a group dental plan
through Principal. Volano pays 100% of both your short-term and long-term
disability plans. We also contribute a match up to 3% to a SIMPLE IRA (upon
qualifying period).

There’s always a variety of La Croix and sodas in the fridge and a pot of good
coffee. We have various company & family outings throughout the year. On
Fridays at 4:00 PM, we shut down the code and turn up the music to play games,
drink libations (or La Croix) and have a good laugh.

 **Work Remotely**

Employees may work from home but need to be near Omaha to attend in-person
meetings and work events.

**Become a part of the REP Fitness team!**

REP does more than engineer the most innovative home gym equipment… we help
people hit PR’s, find their strength, and bring the gym home. What started
with two brothers in a garage selling kettlebells has grown into a globally
expanding business with over 100+ employees committed to a shared passion for
fitness. A career at REP demands creativity, ambition and offers the
opportunity to grow with some of the best athletes, teammates, and partners in
the industry.

REP Fitness is seeking a full-stack Shopify developer/engineer to join our
eCommerce team to head the in-house development of RepFitness.com. This role
will lead the optimization of our website experience and build new features
and functionality with a customer-obsessed focus to help scale DTC growth.

This position reports directly to the Director of Marketing/ E-Commerce

**THE COMPANY**

Medely connects medical facilities with top-quality, pre-screened independent
healthcare professionals. We believe that empowering healthcare professionals
will bring more open, efficient, and increasingly higher quality to patient
care. We are a team of sharp, entrepreneurial individuals who are redefining
the way healthcare staffing is done. We are currently looking for candidates
to join our growing team who share our enthusiasm for tackling today’s
toughest challenges in healthcare.

 **HIGHLIGHTS**

\- Founded in 2016 and having recently secured their Series B, Medely is
facing explosive growth in a $3.65 trillion U.S. healthcare market ripe for
tech disruption (Forbes, 2019).  
\- Medely’s staffing platform provides high quality, on-demand professionals
to more than four thousand healthcare facilities in over 50 U.S. markets.
Their network boasts over forty thousand selectively vetted and credentialed
healthcare professionals including nurses, medical assistants, technicians,
and specialists.  
\- Medely has consistently exceeded growth goals and is excited to continue
the momentum in 2021!

 **THE OPPORTUNITY**

At Medely, every team operates our business through amazing web experiences
built specifically to deliver value to customers, whether on the supply or
demand side of our market. Working with backend and mobile engineers, the
Senior Frontend Engineer will create and maintain impactful tools critical to
keeping Medely’s technical platforms exciting and new, delivering value to
both healthcare facilities and professionals.

As a key member of the engineering team and reporting to the Director of
Engineering, the Senior Frontend Engineer will write client-side code for web
applications to improve Medely’s core experience. We’re looking for engineers
who are passionate about developing impactful, high performance web
applications using up-to-date technologies and patterns.

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES

  * Design and implement highly visible user-facing features and applications.
  * Deploy testable frontend code with performance, maintainability, and scale in mind.
  * Collaborate with product managers, designers, and engineers to prototype and implement features.
  * Participate in code reviews, listening to feedback while sharing your knowledge with other members of the team.

ABOUT YOU

  * BS/BA in a technical field such as Computer Science or equivalent experience
  * 5+ years of professional frontend development experience; 3+ years of experience in React, including experience with state management, animations, and Webpack
  * Awareness of performance considerations such as cross-browser compatibility, componentization, and load-time optimizations
  * Strong understanding of React/JavaScript frameworks
  * Experience architecting single page applications
  * Experience designing mobile-first web applications
  * Ability to collaborate across multiple teams and be willing to roll up your sleeves and execute!
  * Experience with React Native
  * Working with complex frontend projects with highly interactive features
  * Experience developing with and integrating APIs

 **WHY MEDELY:** BENEFITS & PERKS

\- Competitive Compensation: Based on experience and performance  
\- Long Term Incentives: 401k  
\- Healthcare Benefits: Full suite of benefits including medical, dental, and
vision insurance  
\- Flexibility: We believe that work/life balance is important, so we offer
three weeks of vacation and ten paid holidays  
\- Energetic team environment  
\- Purpose: Join a growing mission-oriented startup that is modernizing the
healthcare industry on a national scale!  
\- Ownership: Drive meaningful business impact on a team that you’ll help
build and define!  
\- Remote: Work in a digital environment with all the tools to achieve your
work as though you were in the office!

 _We're an equal opportunity employer to all. We interview and hire applicants
of all backgrounds, orientations, expressions, and identities._

**Front-End Developer**

Our client seeks a passionate, detail-oriented Front-End Developer to join
their collaborative team in South Jordan, UT. This is an in-office position
with options for hybrid work.

Do you have excellent verbal and written communications skills as a business
professional? Do you have the ability to quickly learn and understand new
technologies and applications?

Are you a skilled developer who can debug issues quickly? If yes, this may be
the perfect Front-End Developer position for you. Keep scrolling to see what
this company has to offer.

 **The Perks!**

  * Competitive salary: $70k-$105k DOE
  * Medical/Dental (eligible the first of the month after 60 days)
  * Health Savings Account with employer contribution
  * Matching 401K
  * Competitive salary plus incentive
  * Car Allowance
  * Employee access to discounted products
  * Five days paid time off between Christmas and New Years

 **A Day in the Life of the Front-End Developer**

As the Front-End Web Developer, you are responsible for development,
maintenance and support of internal web applications, marketing sites, and
e-commerce web applications using JavaScript and other web technologies. This
position will work closely with other team members and end-users to define
business requirements and produce quality applications. In addition, you will
be responsible for the maintenance and support of these applications.

 **Responsibilities include:**

  * Updating, repairing, and modifying existing web applications and marketing websites.
  * Work effectively in a collaborative environment with other developers and business team members.
  * Code, test, and debug both new and existing code to ensure application behaves as intended.
  * Support end-users with the maintenance of web-site content and code.
  * Communicate with management project status, direction, and user needs.
  * Synthesize business requirements and transform them into solutions leveraging web-based technologies.
  * Validate code changes when placed into production.
  * Write unit-tests and work with testing staff to ensure code written works as designed and satisfies business requirements.
  * Assist in documenting code and processes to aid other team members.
  * Achieve deadlines and goals while delivering well written code and an excellent quality product.

 **Qualifications**

  * Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, another related field or equivalent technical experience.
  * At least 3+ years proven experience working as a Front-End Web Developer.
  * Proficient understanding of open-source web technologies including JavaScript, HTML and CSS.
  * Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them.
  * Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, especially GIT.
  * Experienced developing applications using ReactJS.
  * Understanding of CSS pre-processing, such as SASS/LESS.
  * Understanding of advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks.
  * Understanding of frontend tooling, such as Grunt and Webpack.
  * Understanding of SEO principles and ensuring that the site will adhere to them.
  * Understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX.
  * Understanding of performance best-practices when using frontend technologies.
  * Basic knowledge of image authoring and industry standard design tools.

 _Are you a digital designer, content creator, and web developer who loves
creating experiences that inspire brand loyalty? Do you dream of navigation

innovative design? A passion for drums and supporting drummers? If so, we want
you on our team!_

Drum Workshop is looking for a talented **Front-End Web Designer & Developer**
to champion the design and development of our ever-growing stable of brand
websites. As a key member of our Web Development team, your mission is to
ensure the alignment of web design and user experience requirements, maximum
efficiency, maintain brand consistency across all our web pages, and optimize
them for SEO. Our ideal candidate has an authentic passion for design and can
offer ideas, suggestions, and best practices while keeping the overarching
business goals in focus. This role allows you to leverage your demonstrated
design knowledge to grow the DW family of brands. If you’re personable, a
great communicator, and a problem solver, you will thrive with our team. A
passion for drums, experience in the music industry or as a working musician
is highly valued.

 **Day-to-day as our Front-End Web Designer & Developer: **

· Collaborate with the team to realize creative ideas and campaigns

· Test/improve website performance, optimization, and responsiveness across
devices and browsers

· Implement SEO and keyword functionality

· Design marketing assets

· Create mock-ups for web pages, web promos, digital advertising, and email
blasts

· Collaborate on the design of wireframes, web flows, and user experience

· Develop and support marketing creative concepts and implementation

· Design visual imagery aligned with respective brands

· Assist with B2C/B2B email communications across brands

· Suggest new technologies and visual enhancements

· Update website content/copy

 **What You Bring as our Front-End Web Designer & Developer: **

· 3+ years of demonstrated experience in web design, preferably in e-commerce

· Solid knowledge of CMS systems (WordPress and Shopify)

· Advanced proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

· Driven multi-tasker with a can-do attitude and ability to problem solve and
think outside the box

· A portfolio you’re proud to brag about

Founded in 1972, Drum Workshop, Inc. is a family-owned and operated musical
instrument company best known for designing and manufacturing award-winning
drums, pedals, hardware, and accessories. Drum Workshop manufactures, markets,
and distributes an iconic portfolio of brands including DW® Drums and
Hardware, PDP®, Gretsch® Drums, and Latin Percussion®. DW’s wide range of
products have earned their reputation as The Drummer’s Choice and are endorsed
by many of the world’s top artists, including Phil Collins, Chad Smith, Sheila
E., Mick Fleetwood, Taylor Hawkins, and Dave Grohl, among others. For more
information, visit DWDrums.com.

We continually strive to elevate the art form of drumming in the world. Our
mission is to educate, enhance, and help unify the drumming community - from
beginners to professionals. We believe we can make a difference, and that
difference begins with our team members. Honesty, innovation, passion,
education, and excellence are essential. We celebrate diverse musical
expression and creativity with our instruments and value the same diversity in
our people.

 **WHO WE ARE**  
We are Adaptive, a growing and successful software company with a great
reputation amongst staff and clients alike. We work closely with our financial
clients to build bespoke software solutions to support their business goals.
Our client's success relies on us making sound technical decisions,
collaborating with stakeholders and being up to date with the latest
technology and practices in the Fintech industry.

 **The Role:**  
Our New York office is looking for a senior Web Developer to deliver a next-
generation all-to-all real time trading platform to serve the North American
institutional market. The platform will be delivered in a greenfield manner
with a modern technology stack throughout. This includes a reactive HTML5
front-end and a clustered, resilient back-end. Adaptive has unique experience
delivering similar platforms and the person in this role will be crucial to
leveraging that internal knowledge and driving the delivery directly in
partnership with the client and their senior management.

As a web applications developer, you will:

  * Build greenfield financial applications alongside your Adaptive colleagues
  * Use the latest technology to create elegant and robust solutions
  * Contribute to building and releasing quality software on time
  * Use your knowledge to build great-looking, event-driven and highly interactive interfaces
  * Collaborate with server-side developers, user-experience designers and business analysts
  * Participate in a test-driven, agile environment
  * Keep up to date with the developments in technology and quickly adapt to them to achieve better results

Required skills and experience:

  * Extensive client-side development experience, gained while building single-page web applications
  * Expertise in JavaScript: you understand prototypical inheritance, scope, and closures
  * Proficiency in user-interface technologies in addition to JavaScript, eg HTML5 and CSS3; and in React.js
  * Practical knowledge of web tooling such as Webpack, NPM, Yarn, Gulp and PostCSS
  * Understanding of ES6 and newer ES specifications
  * Proficient with Chrome developer tools, including knowing how to diagnose and fix performance issues
  * Experience of working on front office systems
  * Language: English (fluent)

Desirable skills and experience:

  * Working with distributed teams
  * TypeScript, Rx.js, Redux
  * Event-driven APIs
  * Real time trading experience

Personal qualities:

  * Strong desire to raise the bar for your team technically
  * Tenacious, curious, and collaborative in all aspects of your work
  * A quick learner with excellent communication skills

In return, we offer:  
Benefits:

  * Medical, dental, and vision
  * 23 days vacation
  * LTD/STD
  * 401K where we match contributions up to 5% of base
  * Gym subsidy
  * FLSA
  * Commuter benefits

About Us  
Want to work with clever people, in an environment where neither politics nor
bad habits get in the way of using your talents to deliver great results?  
You have found the right place. We are Adaptive, where you, as part of a team
of highly skilled software delivery experts, will use the latest technology to
design, build and operate bespoke, real-time solutions for Tier 1 investment
banks and commodity trading firms.  
DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION: Diversity and inclusion are key to a great workplace

people hit PR’s, find their strength, and bring the gym home. What started

expanding business with over 100+ employees committed to a shared passion for
fitness. A career at REP demands creativity, ambition and offers the
opportunity to grow with some of the best athletes, teammates, and partners in
the industry.

REP Fitness is seeking a full-stack Shopify developer/engineer to join our
eCommerce team to head the in-house development of RepFitness.com. This role
will lead the optimization of our website experience and build new features
and functionality with a customer-obsessed focus to help scale DTC growth.

This position reports directly to the Director of Marketing/ E-Commerce

  * Work with the eCommerce team to identify and realize short-, medium-, and long-term website goals and help define the future vision for the REP Fitness digital experience.

**ORGANIZATION**

Endgame360 is a fast-growing digital media company that runs Showbiz Cheat
Sheet, Sportscasting, and MotorBiscuit. A creative organization at its core,
Endgame360's primary goal is to delight its millions of monthly readers with
high-quality content. Relentlessly striving to foster a cycle of success,
Endgame360's mission is to combine data, technology, and storytelling to
inform its on-the-go readers with high quality content. The company's three
core values are teamwork, radical honesty, and innovation. With its positive,
results-oriented, and inclusive culture, Endgame360 has been recognized as an
Inc Magazine Best Workplace in 2020.

Publishing since 2009, the company now has over 130 employees across nearly 30
states and enjoys millions of monthly readers across its four sites.
Endgame360 is well-positioned to continue its growth in content, readers, and
revenues, enabling career advancement and opportunities for current and future
team members.

**LOCATION**

Anywhere in the continental United States as the company operates virtually
across approximately 30 states currently. Endgame360 is headquartered in
Asheville, NC, but has been a remote workforce since inception. Preference may
be given to candidates located in states in which we currently operate: AL,
CA, CO, DC, DE, FL, GA, ID, IL, KY, LA, MA, MD, MI, MO, NC, NJ, NM, NY, OH,
OR, PA, SC, TN, TX, VA, VT, WI, or WV. However, we will not automatically
disqualify those living elsewhere in the United States.

**REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS**

The Fullstack Developer role will report directly to our head of Engineering.

  

**COMPENSATION**

**Base annual salary for this position is $120,000 - $140,000, plus bonus,
based on experience and qualifications.**

Endgame360 offers a competitive compensation and benefits package, including
an exceptional bonus plan, flexible time off program, paid parental leave,
paid family medical leave, health, dental, and vision insurances, 401k with
employer match, a continuing education allowance, flexible spending accounts,
health savings accounts, meet & greets, and financial advising. Endgame360
offers short-term disability insurance fully paid by the company. Endgame360
also offers voluntary long-term disability insurance, voluntary life
insurance, and commuter benefits. In addition, this role will include
participation in a long-term incentive plan.

**EQUAL OPPORTUNITY**

At Endgame360, We Insist That You Be You!

Our audience is made up of readers from many cultures and backgrounds. We
celebrate that our team is no different. Here you have freedom to embrace what
makes you, you: who you love, your gender identity and expression, skin color,
age, appearance, disability, neurodiversity, DNA, military/veteran status,
citizenship, and other factors that make up who you are. Your uniqueness is
valued, welcomed, and appreciated here. We are dedicated to providing a
positive workplace and base all employment decisions on your qualifications,
performance, merits, as well as business needs. We are proud to be an Equal
Employment Opportunity Employer.

If this opportunity interests you and you fit the job description, please
submit an application. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please feel

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

_The duties and responsibilities outlined below include essential functions of
the role. Depending on business needs, this role may perform a combination of
some or all of the following duties. Duties, responsibilities, and activities
may change or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice._

As a Fullstack Developer on the team you will:

  * Report directly to our head of Engineering and collaborate with our close-knit technology team.

  * Build the front and back end of leading-edge web applications for high-traffic public facing websites in a Wordpress environment

  * Work with our Product and Marketing teams to define, scope and develop web and mobile web features.

  * Work with our Editorial team to deliver content management tools and UI features.

  * Participate in system and platform architecture, as well as cloud-based infrastructure design and management.

  * Help take our website to the next level.

  * Identify and fix application performance issues.

  * Help mentor and oversee the work of junior developers on the team, and assist in educating non-tech team members on different aspects of technology as needed

  * Effectively communicate technical concepts to a non-technical audience as needed.

  * Quickly research and learn new programming tools and techniques as needed.

  * Assist with code releases where needed, including rolling and testing.

  * Work 100% remotely. Collaborate fluidly and effectively across an all-remote workforce.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

The ideal candidate for the role of Fullstack Developer will have at least 6
years of experience developing web applications and ideally will have
experience working within the Digital Media Industry.

The final candidate will have many of the following experiences, skills, and
personal attributes.

  * Experience with LEMP stack and DevOps in and Agile / Scrum based software development environment

  * Experience building and enhancing web applications on the Wordpress platform.

  * Mastery of PHP and MySQL.

  * Mastery of HTML, JavaScript and CSS.

  * Experience with Linux and comfort with working within the shell.

  * Experience with code versioning, knowledge of optimization techniques for high traffic sites, Grunt, SaSS are required skills.

  * Experience with code versioning, knowledge of optimization techniques for high traffic sites and large datasets, OOP, standards compliant coding are required skills.

  * Knowledge of AWS, Laravel, and data engineering helpful but not required.

  * Eager to learn new skills and grow professionally. Adaptable and resourceful in solving new challenges

  * Ability to estimate time and stick to deadlines

  * Excellent organizational, project management and communication skills.

  * Ability to work independently in an all-remote virtual environment, working effectively via video calls and meetings.

**EDUCATION**

A Bachelors or Associate Degree in Computer Science or related field is
desirable.

In recent years, GM Information Technology has successfully executed the
largest IT transformation in the history of the automotive industry, fully
insourcing what once was a nearly completely outsourced IT function. Today GM
IT is a dynamic and fast paced organization that designs, develops and
maintains all IT infrastructure, applications and solutions enabling GM's
global operations. From designing and building the next generation of electric
and other vehicles to developing a world-class GM experience for our dealers
and customers, GM IT is driving real change in the most iconic automaker on
the planet. Our team delivers unique enterprise-wide IT solutions in cutting-
edge technologies such as mobility, telematics, mission-critical business
systems, supercomputing, cloud, vehicle engineering and real-time computing.
We offer challenging positions for passionate professionals looking to advance
their careers and be a part of an IT organization focused on innovation, speed
and business value.
