Job Title: Junior Software Developer (ASP.NET C# Application Development)
Job Description:
Consider joining our growing team at Accessory Power. We manufacture several
brands of consumer electronic tech accessories: GOgroove® | ENHANCE® | ReVIVE®
| USA Gear® along with a handful of other lines and various accessory
products. We’re growing! Become a vital member of our team and our growth.

 **Basic Description:**

The Junior Software Developer, using their skills in advanced problem solving
and technical programming, works as a key part of our growing department and
in cooperation with the Art Department, Operations, and eCommerce teams to aid
in the creation and ongoing development of in-house software and web
applications which improve our growing and evolving business operations. A
successful candidate will be a critical thinker, a professionally kind
collaborator, and proven problem solver who works well in teams and under
pressure with often competing deadlines. This is an opportunity for a junior
programmer to apply their existing .NET C#, SQL/Database, and web development
skills in an Agile, small and entrepenurial team environment.  
  
**Job Responsibilities:**

  

  * Analyze business problems and help to design technical software solutions to those problems.
  * Help to build custom software applications and web applications which may interact with order systems, customer service systems, inventory systems, and/or shipping systems.
  * Help to identify and resolve bugs occurring in software and web applications.
  * Analyze current software solutions and build enhancements to improve those solutions.

**Requirements**

 **Basic Requirements:**

  * Education: BA in Computer Science or related field of study.
  * Verifiable English language and writing skills.
  * A deep desire to resolve complex problems with creative and organized technical solutions.
  * Proficiency with cross-browser HTML and CSS programming, JavaScript, JQuery, MVC, WCF and WebForms.
  * Understanding of Microsoft Windows services, web services, SOAP, or XML file exchange.
  * Deep understanding of Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design.
  * Proficiency working within and manipulating MS SQL, MySQL, or Firebird databases.
  * Must be able to understand and help generate written documentation for software solutions.

  

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**

  * Experience with software collaboration, project management, or other digital organizational tools.
  * GIT experience in code collaboration.
  * Experience building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers.
  * Extremely organized, have an obsessive attention to detail, and a thirst to multi task.
  * Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
  * Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project.
  * Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs.

**Benefits**

During these difficult times, as we ease our way back into the office by
exceeding State and Local Government Safety Requirements, this position will
report full-time to our HQ in Westlake Village, CA.

Our staff works hard and plays hard too. During normal non-COVID times, we
sponsor many fun activities such as on-site massage treatments, evening
softball and basketball leagues, company outings and events, quarterly
department lunches, and even on-site yoga classes.

Accessory Power full time employees are entitled to a comprehensive benefits
package including: Vacation, Paid Holidays, PPO and HMO Medical Plans, Free
Dental Insurance & Vision Coverage, employee discounts, and a 401(k)
Retirement Plan + employer match.

If you are hired, we will require you to prove that you have received the
COVID-19 vaccine or have a valid religious or medical reason not to be
vaccinated.

**THE COMPANY**

Medely connects medical facilities with top-quality, pre-screened independent
healthcare professionals. We believe that empowering healthcare professionals
will bring more open, efficient, and increasingly higher quality to patient
care. We are a team of sharp, entrepreneurial individuals who are redefining
the way healthcare staffing is done. We are currently looking for candidates
to join our growing team who share our enthusiasm for tackling today’s
toughest challenges in healthcare.

 **HIGHLIGHTS**

\- Founded in 2016 and having recently secured their Series B, Medely is
facing explosive growth in a $3.65 trillion U.S. healthcare market ripe for
tech disruption (Forbes, 2019).  
\- Medely’s staffing platform provides high quality, on-demand professionals
to more than four thousand healthcare facilities in over 50 U.S. markets.
Their network boasts over forty thousand selectively vetted and credentialed
healthcare professionals including nurses, medical assistants, technicians,
and specialists.  
\- Medely has consistently exceeded growth goals and is excited to continue
the momentum in 2021!

 **THE OPPORTUNITY**

At Medely, every team operates our business through amazing web experiences
built specifically to deliver value to customers, whether on the supply or
demand side of our market. Working with backend and mobile engineers, the
Senior Frontend Engineer will create and maintain impactful tools critical to
keeping Medely’s technical platforms exciting and new, delivering value to
both healthcare facilities and professionals.

As a key member of the engineering team and reporting to the Director of
Engineering, the Senior Frontend Engineer will write client-side code for web
applications to improve Medely’s core experience. We’re looking for engineers
who are passionate about developing impactful, high performance web
applications using up-to-date technologies and patterns.

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES

  * Design and implement highly visible user-facing features and applications.
  * Deploy testable frontend code with performance, maintainability, and scale in mind.
  * Collaborate with product managers, designers, and engineers to prototype and implement features.
  * Participate in code reviews, listening to feedback while sharing your knowledge with other members of the team.

ABOUT YOU

  * BS/BA in a technical field such as Computer Science or equivalent experience
  * 5+ years of professional frontend development experience; 3+ years of experience in React, including experience with state management, animations, and Webpack
  * Awareness of performance considerations such as cross-browser compatibility, componentization, and load-time optimizations
  * Strong understanding of React/JavaScript frameworks
  * Experience architecting single page applications
  * Experience designing mobile-first web applications
  * Ability to collaborate across multiple teams and be willing to roll up your sleeves and execute!
  * Experience with React Native
  * Working with complex frontend projects with highly interactive features
  * Experience developing with and integrating APIs

 **WHY MEDELY:** BENEFITS & PERKS

\- Competitive Compensation: Based on experience and performance  
\- Long Term Incentives: 401k  
\- Healthcare Benefits: Full suite of benefits including medical, dental, and
vision insurance  
\- Flexibility: We believe that work/life balance is important, so we offer
three weeks of vacation and ten paid holidays  
\- Energetic team environment  
\- Purpose: Join a growing mission-oriented startup that is modernizing the
healthcare industry on a national scale!  
\- Ownership: Drive meaningful business impact on a team that you’ll help
build and define!  
\- Remote: Work in a digital environment with all the tools to achieve your
work as though you were in the office!

 _We're an equal opportunity employer to all. We interview and hire applicants
of all backgrounds, orientations, expressions, and identities._

 _Work location is flexible if approved by Medely, except that position may
not be performed remotely from the state of Colorado._

 _Medely does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. We consider any
resume (CV) or biography received from an agency or outside recruiter without
prior approval from a member of the Medely Human Resources or Recruiting team
to be unsolicited and gratuitous, and such submissions will not be recognized
by Medely for purposes of “ownership” of the candidate._

Senior Web Developer/Engineer - Remote Opportunity

MaxMind (www.maxmind.com) is looking for a talented, experienced, and highly
motivated Senior Web Developer/Engineer to help us develop and improve our
products. We help protect thousands of companies worldwide from fraud,
screening over a billion online transactions each year, and we provide IP
intelligence data to thousands more. As a Senior Web Developer/Engineer, you
will play an important role in improving our existing websites and
applications.

This is a full time remote position, and we welcome candidates to apply from
the following states CA, CO, FL, LA, MN, NV, NY (excluding New York City and
Yonkers), NC, OR, PA, TX, WA, and anywhere in Canada.

MaxMind does not currently sponsor US employment visas. For Canadian
candidates, you must be eligible/authorized to work in Canada.

 **The Position**  
You will be responsible for developing websites and applications. This
includes creating new web applications to help our clients better detect fraud
while also working to improve our existing applications and websites. In doing
this, you will work closely with our product team as well as other engineers.

Our salary range for Senior Web Developer/Engineer roles begins at $140k USD
or $172k CAD (in Canada). See more about benefits and compensation below.

 **Our Development Practices**  
We prefer Bootstrap and vanilla JS for most of our website work, but we
selectively use TypeScript and React when we need to create web applications.
We use Mojolicious on Perl for server side rendering. We also have REST APIs
written in Go. We use PostgreSQL as our database. Our servers run Linux on
Google Cloud Platform.

We maintain high standards for our development practices. All new code is
expected to include automated tests run by TeamCity, and all work goes through
internal code review on GitHub Enterprise.

 **About You - Minimum qualifications**

  * Experience with backend web development. Although we use Mojolicious on Perl as well as Go, we are happy to hear from people with Ruby, Python, modern PHP, or similar experience.

  * Strong knowledge of JavaScript. You should have extensive knowledge of vanilla JS.
  * Experience writing unit and integration tests for both frontend and backend code.
  * Strong knowledge of modern CSS, including using CSS frameworks like Bootstrap as well as CSS preprocessors such as Sass or Less.
  * Experience with responsive web design.
  * Experience writing SQL queries.
  * Experience with revision control, preferably Git.
  * Excellent written and spoken communication skills.
  * The ability to work with a geographically dispersed team.
  * Capable with the command line.

 **Desired, but not required**

It’s also a big plus if you have any of the following:

  * Experience with TypeScript.
  * Experience with at least one modern framework such as React (preferred) or Vue.
  * Working knowledge of graphic design tools such as Sketch, Photoshop, and Illustrator.
  * User interface and experience design skills.
  * Interest in performance and security.
  * Open source contributions.
  * Experience doing code reviews.

 **Why work at MaxMind?**  
In a recent survey, employees listed having a supportive work culture, good
co-workers, autonomy, and feeling trusted, valued, and respected as some of
the things they like most about working here.

MaxMind has a social mission. MaxMind donates over 60% of profits to
charities.

MaxMind’s compensation strives to reward getting stuff done, quality of work,
and working well with others.

Our culture is very important to us. We’re friendly, collaborative, and work-
focused. We don’t like office politics and unnecessary stress. We like to have
productive workdays and don’t like work to chase us when we’re done for the
day. We maintain a set of core, overlapping hours, but are flexible with
specific start and end times and are understanding about appointments and life
events. We care about helping each other succeed.

Our engineering team works remotely so communication centers around video
chat, group chat, and Agile planning tools.

Normally, we hold an annual company summit one time per year in Waltham, MA.

 **Benefits**  
In addition to competitive compensation, our US benefits include medical,
dental, vision, life, and short and long term disability insurance, a Safe
Harbor 401(k) with employer contribution, Health Savings Account, Limited
Purpose Flexible Spending Account, Dependent Care Account, paid parental
leave, and public transit reimbursement.

Our Canadian benefits include medical, dental, vision, life, accidental death
and dismemberment, critical Illness, short and long term disability insurance,
Employee and Family Assistance Program, and paid parental leave. You also have
access to a group Retirement Savings Plan. In lieu of a Canadian RRSP
contribution we provide a bonus payout at the end of each year that employees
may decide to use toward retirement savings.

Everyone participates in a company performance-based bonus plan. MaxMind
offers a $2,000 professional development budget and five days for professional
development annually.

 **Diversity and Inclusion**  
We're committed to diversity and inclusion and are mindful of incorporating
them into all aspects of our company.

We encourage and sincerely welcome applications from candidates of color,
women, queer candidates, candidates with family caregiving responsibilities,
transgender candidates, and from other communities not well represented in the
tech world.

See our complete diversity and inclusion statement.

 _Resumes without cover letters will not be considered. We want to know about
you, please share any projects or accomplishments and include a link so we can
learn more. One of the first steps in our interviewing process is a homework
assignment, and we will ask you for a submission so we can gain insight into
your work._

Job Description:
Requisition ID: R10027183

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on
revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and
for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to
be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history
- from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to
landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a
pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the
way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and
bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what
others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history,
they're making history.

  
Northrop Grumman Defense Systems (NGDS), Beavercreek Ohio, is seeking Full
Stack Web Developers. The successful candidates will demonstrate a broad skill
set balanced between interpersonal and technical capabilities achieving
sustainable quality products. They will have a track record as an effective
communicator and problem solver who is able to develop and maintain good
working relationships with internal and external stakeholders. The selected
candidates will participate in the entire software development lifecycle with
a concentration in software engineering. They will implement solutions in a
web-based environment and integrate them into a microservice cloud-based
architecture.

The candidates will work closely with other software developers accomplishing
the following:

  * Support team in completing necessary software on schedule
  * Complete work independently and as a part of an Agile team
  * Solve complex problems through innovative and creative solutions
  * Collaborate with software designers and/or software engineers in the planning, design, development, and utilization of software systems
  * Regularly demonstrate progress to customers This requisition may be filled at a higher grade based on qualifications listed below.

 **Basic Qualifications:**

This requisition may be filled at either a Software or Principal Software
Engineer level.

BQs for a Software Engineer 2 are: 6+ years relevant software development
experience with high school diploma; Will also consider 2+ years relevant

 **A Day in the Life of the Front-End Developer**

As the Front-End Web Developer, you are responsible for development,
maintenance and support of internal web applications, marketing sites, and
e-commerce web applications using JavaScript and other web technologies. This
position will work closely with other team members and end-users to define
business requirements and produce quality applications. In addition, you will
be responsible for the maintenance and support of these applications.

 **Responsibilities include:**

  * Updating, repairing, and modifying existing web applications and marketing websites.
  * Work effectively in a collaborative environment with other developers and business team members.
  * Code, test, and debug both new and existing code to ensure application behaves as intended.
  * Support end-users with the maintenance of web-site content and code.
  * Communicate with management project status, direction, and user needs.
  * Synthesize business requirements and transform them into solutions leveraging web-based technologies.
  * Validate code changes when placed into production.
  * Write unit-tests and work with testing staff to ensure code written works as designed and satisfies business requirements.
  * Assist in documenting code and processes to aid other team members.
  * Achieve deadlines and goals while delivering well written code and an excellent quality product.

 **Qualifications**

  * Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, another related field or equivalent technical experience.
  * At least 3+ years proven experience working as a Front-End Web Developer.
  * Proficient understanding of open-source web technologies including JavaScript, HTML and CSS.
  * Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them.
  * Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, especially GIT.
  * Experienced developing applications using ReactJS.
  * Understanding of CSS pre-processing, such as SASS/LESS.
  * Understanding of advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks.
  * Understanding of frontend tooling, such as Grunt and Webpack.
  * Understanding of SEO principles and ensuring that the site will adhere to them.
  * Understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX.
  * Understanding of performance best-practices when using frontend technologies.
  * Basic knowledge of image authoring and industry standard design tools.

generation all-to-all real time trading platform to serve the North American
institutional market. The platform will be delivered in a greenfield manner
with a modern technology stack throughout. This includes a reactive HTML5
front-end and a clustered, resilient back-end. Adaptive has unique experience
delivering similar platforms and the person in this role will be crucial to
leveraging that internal knowledge and driving the delivery directly in
partnership with the client and their senior management.

As a web applications developer, you will:

  * Build greenfield financial applications alongside your Adaptive colleagues

  * Collaborate with server-side developers, user-experience designers and business analysts
  * Participate in a test-driven, agile environment
  * Keep up to date with the developments in technology and quickly adapt to them to achieve better results

  * Expertise in JavaScript: you understand prototypical inheritance, scope, and closures

  * Practical knowledge of web tooling such as Webpack, NPM, Yarn, Gulp and PostCSS
  * Understanding of ES6 and newer ES specifications
  * Proficient with Chrome developer tools, including knowing how to diagnose and fix performance issues
  * Experience of working on front office systems
  * Language: English (fluent)

Desirable skills and experience:

  * TypeScript, Rx.js, Redux
  * Event-driven APIs
  * Real time trading experience

Personal qualities:

**Job Summary:**

As an Applications Developer, you will develop and maintain applications and
supporting products such as API integrations. This includes assisting with
technical design, writing code, and implementing new applications on both
tablets and phones; integrating apps with back end systems and/or data tables;
and performing day-to-day administration of the current application portfolio.
You will also be responsible for contact with vendor support and providing
level 3 support with Help Desk issues.

 **  
Essential Functions:**

  * Maintain and document all end user access, login and password identification.
  * Create, configure and maintain standard as well as custom applications within the Walsworth internal and external environments.
  * Perform system level maintenance and request external vendor support when necessary.
  * Record, track, and document all system issues and resolution.
  * Communicate application problems and issues to key stakeholders, including management, development teams, end users, and unit leaders.
  * Participate in the implementation of new development with assigned teams.
  * Conduct research into current and emerging technologies and issues in support of development efforts.
  * Work with database administrator to design, develop, and update databases as they relate to assigned applications.

 **  
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**

  * Experience with languages, scripting and frameworks including HTML, CSS, JAVA, JavaScript, PHP, API/Webservices (REST & SOAP), Angular
  * Experience with Adobe Cloud applications
  * Broad advanced knowledge of business operations
  * Ability to communicate all planned interfaces to all personnel involved as well as management.
  * Ability to conduct research into and resolve software issues, standards and products as required.
  * Strong understanding of database structures, theories, principles, and practices
  * Working technical experience with system software environments
  * Strong technical documentation skills
  * Ability to handle multiple tasks and projects.
  * Ability to remain organized and self-directed in a fast-paced environment.
  * Ability to work in a team environment.
  * Ability to interface with a variety of individuals or groups on a frequent basis.
  * Ability to work with limited direction and supervision, while demonstrating good judgment and strict confidence.
  * Ability to learn computer applications as necessary for the position.
  * Must successfully complete any training or certification courses required to support or strengthen position.
  * Ability to read, interpret and follow verbal and written instructions, work procedures and other related materials.
  * Excellent verbal and written communication skills including strong customer service skills.
  * Must communicate appropriate information accurately and clearly as needed.
  * Demonstrated advanced proficiency with MS Word, Excel, Outlook and Windows based databases.

 **  
Minimum Requirements:**

  * Bachelors degree in Information Technology or a related field and four years experience in application development or a related function OR
  * Associate degree in Information Technology or a related field and six years experience in application development or a related function OR
  * High School Diploma or GED eight years experience in application development or a related function OR

**ORGANIZATION**

Endgame360 is a fast-growing digital media company that runs Showbiz Cheat
Sheet, Sportscasting, and MotorBiscuit. A creative organization at its core,
Endgame360's primary goal is to delight its millions of monthly readers with
high-quality content. Relentlessly striving to foster a cycle of success,
Endgame360's mission is to combine data, technology, and storytelling to
inform its on-the-go readers with high quality content. The company's three
core values are teamwork, radical honesty, and innovation. With its positive,
results-oriented, and inclusive culture, Endgame360 has been recognized as an
Inc Magazine Best Workplace in 2020.

Publishing since 2009, the company now has over 130 employees across nearly 30
states and enjoys millions of monthly readers across its four sites.
Endgame360 is well-positioned to continue its growth in content, readers, and
revenues, enabling career advancement and opportunities for current and future
team members.

**LOCATION**

Anywhere in the continental United States as the company operates virtually
across approximately 30 states currently. Endgame360 is headquartered in
Asheville, NC, but has been a remote workforce since inception. Preference may
be given to candidates located in states in which we currently operate: AL,
CA, CO, DC, DE, FL, GA, ID, IL, KY, LA, MA, MD, MI, MO, NC, NJ, NM, NY, OH,
OR, PA, SC, TN, TX, VA, VT, WI, or WV. However, we will not automatically
disqualify those living elsewhere in the United States.

**REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS**

The Fullstack Developer role will report directly to our head of Engineering.

  

**COMPENSATION**

**Base annual salary for this position is $120,000 - $140,000, plus bonus,
based on experience and qualifications.**

Endgame360 offers a competitive compensation and benefits package, including
an exceptional bonus plan, flexible time off program, paid parental leave,
paid family medical leave, health, dental, and vision insurances, 401k with
employer match, a continuing education allowance, flexible spending accounts,
health savings accounts, meet & greets, and financial advising. Endgame360
offers short-term disability insurance fully paid by the company. Endgame360
also offers voluntary long-term disability insurance, voluntary life
insurance, and commuter benefits. In addition, this role will include
participation in a long-term incentive plan.

**EQUAL OPPORTUNITY**

At Endgame360, We Insist That You Be You!

Our audience is made up of readers from many cultures and backgrounds. We
celebrate that our team is no different. Here you have freedom to embrace what
makes you, you: who you love, your gender identity and expression, skin color,
age, appearance, disability, neurodiversity, DNA, military/veteran status,
citizenship, and other factors that make up who you are. Your uniqueness is
valued, welcomed, and appreciated here. We are dedicated to providing a
positive workplace and base all employment decisions on your qualifications,
performance, merits, as well as business needs. We are proud to be an Equal
Employment Opportunity Employer.

**CONTACT INFORMATION**

If this opportunity interests you and you fit the job description, please
submit an application. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please feel
free to contact People Ops at hr@cheatsheet.com to discuss.

_The duties and responsibilities outlined below include essential functions of
the role. Depending on business needs, this role may perform a combination of
some or all of the following duties. Duties, responsibilities, and activities
may change or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice._

As a Fullstack Developer on the team you will:

  * Report directly to our head of Engineering and collaborate with our close-knit technology team.

  * Build the front and back end of leading-edge web applications for high-traffic public facing websites in a Wordpress environment

  * Work with our Product and Marketing teams to define, scope and develop web and mobile web features.

  * Participate in system and platform architecture, as well as cloud-based infrastructure design and management.

  * Help take our website to the next level.

  * Identify and fix application performance issues.

  * Help mentor and oversee the work of junior developers on the team, and assist in educating non-tech team members on different aspects of technology as needed

  * Effectively communicate technical concepts to a non-technical audience as needed.

  * Quickly research and learn new programming tools and techniques as needed.

  * Assist with code releases where needed, including rolling and testing.

  * Work 100% remotely. Collaborate fluidly and effectively across an all-remote workforce.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

The ideal candidate for the role of Fullstack Developer will have at least 6
years of experience developing web applications and ideally will have
experience working within the Digital Media Industry.

The final candidate will have many of the following experiences, skills, and
personal attributes.

  * Experience with LEMP stack and DevOps in and Agile / Scrum based software development environment

  * Experience building and enhancing web applications on the Wordpress platform.

  * Mastery of PHP and MySQL.

  * Mastery of HTML, JavaScript and CSS.

  * Experience with Linux and comfort with working within the shell.

  * Experience with code versioning, knowledge of optimization techniques for high traffic sites, Grunt, SaSS are required skills.

  * Experience with code versioning, knowledge of optimization techniques for high traffic sites and large datasets, OOP, standards compliant coding are required skills.

  * Knowledge of AWS, Laravel, and data engineering helpful but not required.

  * Eager to learn new skills and grow professionally. Adaptable and resourceful in solving new challenges

  * Ability to estimate time and stick to deadlines

  * Excellent organizational, project management and communication skills.

  * Ability to work independently in an all-remote virtual environment, working effectively via video calls and meetings.

**EDUCATION**

A Bachelors or Associate Degree in Computer Science or related field is
desirable.

  * Analytical and detail-oriented
  * Excellent verbal and written communications skills
  * Advanced problem solving skills

 **Preferred Qualifications**

  * SEO
  * eCommerce (Shopify)

growing team. At Volano, you will work with a variety of clients and projects
alongside a remarkable team of back-end and front-end developers, designers,
and management to build web and mobile applications.

Volano builds workflow-centric software using the latest proven technologies.
These solutions are created in collaboration with our clients in an agile,
iterative fashion – and typically new from the ground up.

 **Core Functions of this Role**

The people we'll consider for this position must have a thorough understanding
of building and deploying web applications using a variety of tools and
frameworks, such as:

  * ASP.NET MVC
  * C#
  * .NET Core
  * SQL Server
  * Entity Framework/Linq

 **About Volano Software**

Volano is made up of smart, friendly, creative people who treat each other
like family and who work together to deliver quality custom software to our
clients. We love to be challenged. But we ensure our team members also feel
supported. And we balance getting our work done with not taking ourselves too
seriously.

  * Perform to Completion
  * Take Pride in Our Work

 **Benefits and Perks**

There’s always a variety of La Croix and sodas in the fridge and a pot of good

The AAM Group’s Web Developers and Junior Developers are web-based programmers
working in PHP, JavaScript, and React, that are responsible for helping to
build web-based software that is used by our stakeholders. They work alongside
AAM’s team of programmers to help build and develop our next big idea as well
as helping to maintain existing ones.

 **Who We Are**

AAM is the largest program distribution group in the specialty automotive
aftermarket (TheAAMGroup.com). We provide services for customers of our
wholesale distribution members, which collectively operate nearly 60
warehouses across North America. We reach more than 14,000 resellers of many
types, including 4×4 shops, spray-in bedliner shops, camper top shops, speed
shops, machine shops and engine builders, fleet upfitters, and many other
specialized local automotive shops. Our job at headquarters is to facilitate
purchases for our members and provide marketing tools and services to their
resellers to help them be more successful businesses—ultimately driving more
purchases to our members and the suppliers that support us.

Our fastest-growing offering is Aftermarket Websites®
(AftermarketWebsites.com): a website-building service just for retailers and
installers in the specialty automotive aftermarket. Built BY the industry, FOR
the industry, our sites point consumers searching for products to their local
brick-and-mortar options (i.e., the shops you’ll be designing websites for).
This robust, e-commerce–ready platform lets shop owners upload product
information, including pricing, to reach consumers searching for the products
they sell. Aftermarket Websites® currently hosts more than 100 websites, and
we are adding more every month.

We’re on a mission to build the best websites for the best price for our
stores. We are a hardworking, close-knit team, and nobody in the automotive
aftermarket industry does what we do as well as we do it. For more information
about who we are, check out our organization’s most recent presentation book:
TheAAMGroup.com/partners.

**The IDEAL Candidate**

You are highly creative, passionate about web development, detail-oriented,
and can follow directions well. An important part of this position involves
cultivating a deep understanding of our website platforms (don’t worry, we’ll
teach you!) to be able to build and fine-tune our software for the betterment
of our customers. We need good developers that can write clean code, learn
from their mistakes, and understand the best outcomes for our customers to
ensure we keep improving. Programmers can never stop learning. There is always
new technologies and better ways to do something than the last time you did.

Also, because most people in an office environment are not techies or
typically as qualified on computers as most programmers are, from time-to-time
help fix office-related computer problems and help to implement best practices
with IT.

Last, the ideal candidate is fun, respectful, kind, and does their job without
needing to be micro-managed. We don’t want to hover any more than you want us
hovering, but you’ll receive support whenever you need it.

**This is NOT a remote position** —we want the pleasure of your company in the
office!

**Job Duties**

  * Build, develop, and create new software that meets expectations and is delivered on time.

  * Ensure that created software is well tested and functions as intended when used by others.

  * Maintain/update existing tools and software with new features and improvements.

  * Help to maintain AAM’s hardware in the office – Desk computers, laptops, servers, and all other equipment.

  * General Office IT – Work with AAM staff to help manage, install, and update computers throughout the office.

  * Participate in regular code reviews to help you learn and enhance your coding skills.

 **Skill Requirements**

  * Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science

  * Excellent computer skills

  * Basic/Moderate understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript (ES6), React, and PHP

  * Capable of developing Object-Oriented PHP software

  * Firm knowledge of building SQL queries (MySQL) and working with complex database structures

  * Experience with Git Hub/Git

  * Understanding of TypeScript, SCSS, Docker, and Webpack and added plus.

  * Must have experience developing in MVC Framework. CodeIgniter 2/3/4 or Laravel is an added plus.

  * Must be able to gather requirements, build code, and work independently as well as work jointly with the team.

  * Must take pride in paying attention to the details.

  * Must have problem-solving mentality and the ability to weigh the priorities of various work demands.

  * Must be focused and self-motivated.

  * Must have strong verbal & written communication skills

  * Must be able to work from our Piney Flats office. No remote or offsite work offered.

for a variety of clients serving University of Utah Health. Candidate will

Candidate will work closely with other departments and web team members and

Position Summary  
Education _Dynamics_ is a marketing and enrollment management services and
technology company dedicated to connecting students with the right school for
them. We are higher education experts and full-funnel marketers who live and
breathe data, optimization, and results.

The Lead Web Developer guides the web development process for our diverse set
of client websites and landing pages in our Enrollment Management marketing
services division. We are seeking an experienced leader, dynamic problem
solver, strong communicator, and self-motivated individual to join our team as
the technical subject matter expert and owner of the creation, enhancement,
and maintenance of our growing suite of digital marketing focused client
websites. This position reports to the Senior Director of Software
Development.  
Primary Responsibilities

  * Hands on front-end web development for responsive websites running on WordPress CMS, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript and PHP.
  * Manage a small team of web developers by triaging tasks, assigning them to an appropriate resource, maintaining development and deployment schedules in collaboration with business stakeholders and project management.
  * Maintain development infrastructure and processes including Git source control, code promotion and production deployment.
  * Provide leadership, mentoring and guidance to the web development team. Strive to maintain high morale and pride in work and accomplishments, advocate for providing well designed solutions. Motivate and empower the team to make a difference in the business outcomes.
  * Keep in touch with current web development best practices, tools, and frameworks, and be proactive in strategically bringing those emerging trends to our sites.
  * Interact with clients directly to help gather requirements for new site implementations and to exchange ideas on site redesigns and major feature releases.
  * Work with business stakeholders to analyze and troubleshoot issues and process breakdowns.
  * Work with technical decisions makers to suggest and help implement architecture and process improvements.

Required Skills & Experience

  * 5+ years’ experience in web development, at least 1 year of experience in a leadership role.
  * Strong knowledge and extensive experience in CSS, HTML, JavaScript.
  * Understanding of developing responsive websites built for high traffic digital marketing experiences.
  * Demonstrated leadership qualities managing an internal team and effectively working with business stakeholders.
  * Experience with Git source control.
  * Experience with creating, maintaining, and enhancing websites running on WordPress CMS platform.
  * Experience developing with PHP in a WordPress environment, including custom themes and plugins.
  * Strong understanding of website performance and Core Web Vitals (CWV).
  * Experience working with databases and SQL queries.
  * Drupal and .Net experience a plus.
  * Enjoy working in a positive and team-oriented environment that rewards “working smart” and praises effective collaboration.

Education

  * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Web Design (or another related field) or equivalent experience.

portfolio.

Intersect Digital is seeking a Senior Front-End Web Developer who has solid
HTML, CSS and vanilla JavaScript skills to assist with support and maintenance
of existing websites.

The work consists of content updates, however the occasional webpage redesign
and full website build will also be a part of the developer's workload.
Because the sites are hosted in Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), experience
working with a content management system is a plus.

This position is meant for someone who can build complex projects that require
a lot of skill and precision. We are seeking candidates with strong
demonstrable skills in CSS and vanilla JavaScript. Familiarity with modern
JS/CSS frameworks is a nice to have.

Our work environment is fast-paced and deadline driven. Business requirements
and scopes change frequently. Our team members are typically working on a few
different projects at once. We are looking for someone who has strong time
management skills, who can work well both independently and with a team of
project managers, tech leads and other developers to produce high quality
functional output.

Strong communication is essential to be successful here. You are able to share
your ideas in both a technical and non-technical way, ask for help when you
need it, and raise appropriate concerns quickly regarding blockers to project
completion.

As we are a marketing agency, we have many clients who need to convert their
business needs into functional performant web features. Being able to turn a
business requirement to a web page, site, or feature will make you a strong
candidate for our open position. Agency experience is a plus.

  * Implement content updates and feature additions to existing web sites.
  * Handle bug fixes to sites (even if the bugs aren't yours!)
  * Build fast loading, responsive, cross-browser compatible web pages and sites.

  * Ensure feature updates follow ADA and AODA Accessibility compliance.
  * Optimize existing websites for maximum speed and scalability.
  * Provide solid recommendations for clean, functionally sound HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
  * Work with design tools such as InDesign, InVision, Photoshop, etc. for asset creation, image resizing and site mockups.
  * Communicate immediately with team members and project managers on status updates, deadlines, blockers and changes in scope.

 **Required Skills**

  * Minimum of 6 years experience in web design and development
  * Version Control(Git/SVN) Experience
  * Expert at HTML/CSS
  * Expert proficiency in client-side scripting using vanilla JavaScript.
  * Familiarity with Modern JS frameworks (Angular/React)

  * Experience building sites from scratch
  * Strong, effective, mindful communication skills.

  * Ability to work both independently with little direction and as part of a team of developers with different experience levels.
  * Ability to flex and adapt. Our deadlines shift and our scopes change.
  * Ability to self-prioritize when given multiple responsibilities.
  * Strong understanding of mobile-first and responsive design concepts.

  * Strong understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them.

  * Demonstrable understanding of Web Accessibility Compliance (ADA, AODA,WCAG)
  * Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, InVision, Figma, InDesign and other visual design tools.
  * Proficiency with Content Management Systems

  * Background in Graphic Design
  * Experience with modern CSS tools and frameworks like Grid, Flexbox or Bootstrap
  * Experience with optimizing web site load times
  * Familiarity with basic SEO principles

  * Familiarity with remote collaboration tools such as Trello and Slack as well as experience with Video Conferencing tools such as Microsoft Teams, Google Meet, Zoom, etc.

for a sponsor.**

Job Title: Junior Software Developer (ASP.NET C# Application Development)
Job Description:
Consider joining our growing team at Accessory Power. We manufacture several
brands of consumer electronic tech accessories: GOgroove® | ENHANCE® | ReVIVE®
| USA Gear® along with a handful of other lines and various accessory
products. We’re growing! Become a vital member of our team and our growth.

 **Basic Description:**

The Junior Software Developer, using their skills in advanced problem solving
and technical programming, works as a key part of our growing department and
in cooperation with the Art Department, Operations, and eCommerce teams to aid
in the creation and ongoing development of in-house software and web
applications which improve our growing and evolving business operations. A
successful candidate will be a critical thinker, a professionally kind
collaborator, and proven problem solver who works well in teams and under
pressure with often competing deadlines. This is an opportunity for a junior
programmer to apply their existing .NET C#, SQL/Database, and web development
skills in an Agile, small and entrepenurial team environment.  
  
**Job Responsibilities:**

  

  * Analyze business problems and help to design technical software solutions to those problems.
  * Help to build custom software applications and web applications which may interact with order systems, customer service systems, inventory systems, and/or shipping systems.
  * Help to identify and resolve bugs occurring in software and web applications.
  * Analyze current software solutions and build enhancements to improve those solutions.

**Requirements**

 **Basic Requirements:**

  * Education: BA in Computer Science or related field of study.
  * Verifiable English language and writing skills.
  * A deep desire to resolve complex problems with creative and organized technical solutions.
  * Proficiency with cross-browser HTML and CSS programming, JavaScript, JQuery, MVC, WCF and WebForms.
  * Understanding of Microsoft Windows services, web services, SOAP, or XML file exchange.
  * Deep understanding of Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design.
  * Proficiency working within and manipulating MS SQL, MySQL, or Firebird databases.
  * Must be able to understand and help generate written documentation for software solutions.

  

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**

  * Experience with software collaboration, project management, or other digital organizational tools.
  * GIT experience in code collaboration.
  * Experience building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers.
  * Extremely organized, have an obsessive attention to detail, and a thirst to multi task.
  * Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
  * Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project.
  * Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs.

**Benefits**

During these difficult times, as we ease our way back into the office by
exceeding State and Local Government Safety Requirements, this position will
report full-time to our HQ in Westlake Village, CA.

Our staff works hard and plays hard too. During normal non-COVID times, we
sponsor many fun activities such as on-site massage treatments, evening
softball and basketball leagues, company outings and events, quarterly
department lunches, and even on-site yoga classes.

Accessory Power full time employees are entitled to a comprehensive benefits
package including: Vacation, Paid Holidays, PPO and HMO Medical Plans, Free
Dental Insurance & Vision Coverage, employee discounts, and a 401(k)
Retirement Plan + employer match.

If you are hired, we will require you to prove that you have received the
COVID-19 vaccine or have a valid religious or medical reason not to be
vaccinated.

## **Who We Are**

Insurity is a leading property and casualty insurance software and data
analytics providers, working with some of the world’s largest insurers,
brokers, and MGAs, including 15 of the top 25 P&C carriers in the US. With
900+ team members globally, 6 office locations, and 300+ customers, we have a
deep understanding of the insurance business, unparalleled technology
expertise, and a singular focus of delivering a simplified insurance
experience to our customers.

##  **Insurity’s next Senior Software Developer**

As a Senior Developer, you will join our Assigned Resource Team, which focuses
on providing customer-specific solutions within Insurity’s flagship policy
administration system and the related enterprise functionality. In this role,
you’ll own development items end-to-end and provide design & development
guidance as part of a scrum team.

In addition to your work crafting/maintaining/evolving our source code
individually, you will be involved in reviewing the work of other developers
and will lead the technical work of team members.

This position requires an understanding of Object-Oriented Programming
languages, superb communication, and the ability to encourage those around
you.

##  **What You’ll Do**

  * Define, design, and implement technical solutions
  * Build design proposals and prototyping support for new problem spaces and first-time development of highly complex solutions or new & emerging technology
  * Provide in-depth technical troubleshooting, defect investigation, remediation, and root-cause analysis of items
  * Provide estimation and planning input for projects/solutions/work items
  * Develop and implement testing approaches as part of all solutions
  * Develop documentation for software solutions for targeted audiences, which may include internal and external customers
  * Provide peer-review of designs, code, and artifact delivery
  * Provide technical guidance to team members
  * Prepare material/information for partners, including customers
  * Follow existing Insurity standards for coding and documentation (or set new standards where needed)

##  **Who You Are**

  * Minimum of 4 years of experience in software development, preferably in a Microsoft-based enterprise environment
  * Web Development skills (HTML, JavaScript, CSS) coupled with SQL experience
  * Object-Oriented Programming language experience (.NET – VB [Highly Preferred], C#, Java, C++)
  * Ability to work independently on sophisticated issues
  * Ability to provide technical guidance and performance insight to team members
  * Strong written and oral English communication skills with an ability to explain sophisticated/technical items effectively
  * Comfortable to take calls for item resolution if necessary
  * Ability to travel up to 25% (travel is minimal) *

##  **Nice to have:**

  * BS/MS degree in Computer Science or similar
  * Experience with Visual Studio, MS Office, SQL, Scrum/agile tools (JIRA)
  * Knowledge of the commercial property & casualty insurance industry; Workers Comp. ISO lines a preferred
  * Experience working in a remote environment

##  **Our Benefits:**

 **Collaborative Culture | Flexible Hours | Growth Opportunities**

office.

 **To Note:** All roles are expected to begin remotely due to COVID-19.

Internal ID: 1206-INS**

**THE COMPANY**

Medely connects medical facilities with top-quality, pre-screened independent
healthcare professionals. We believe that empowering healthcare professionals
will bring more open, efficient, and increasingly higher quality to patient
care. We are a team of sharp, entrepreneurial individuals who are redefining
the way healthcare staffing is done. We are currently looking for candidates
to join our growing team who share our enthusiasm for tackling today’s
toughest challenges in healthcare.

 **HIGHLIGHTS**

\- Founded in 2016 and having recently secured their Series B, Medely is
facing explosive growth in a $3.65 trillion U.S. healthcare market ripe for
tech disruption (Forbes, 2019).  
\- Medely’s staffing platform provides high quality, on-demand professionals
to more than four thousand healthcare facilities in over 50 U.S. markets.
Their network boasts over forty thousand selectively vetted and credentialed
healthcare professionals including nurses, medical assistants, technicians,
and specialists.  
\- Medely has consistently exceeded growth goals and is excited to continue
the momentum in 2021!

 **THE OPPORTUNITY**

At Medely, every team operates our business through amazing web experiences
built specifically to deliver value to customers, whether on the supply or
demand side of our market. Working with backend and mobile engineers, the
Senior Frontend Engineer will create and maintain impactful tools critical to
keeping Medely’s technical platforms exciting and new, delivering value to
both healthcare facilities and professionals.

As a key member of the engineering team and reporting to the Director of
Engineering, the Senior Frontend Engineer will write client-side code for web
applications to improve Medely’s core experience. We’re looking for engineers
who are passionate about developing impactful, high performance web
applications using up-to-date technologies and patterns.

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES

  * Design and implement highly visible user-facing features and applications.
  * Deploy testable frontend code with performance, maintainability, and scale in mind.
  * Collaborate with product managers, designers, and engineers to prototype and implement features.
  * Participate in code reviews, listening to feedback while sharing your knowledge with other members of the team.

ABOUT YOU

  * BS/BA in a technical field such as Computer Science or equivalent experience
  * 5+ years of professional frontend development experience; 3+ years of experience in React, including experience with state management, animations, and Webpack
  * Awareness of performance considerations such as cross-browser compatibility, componentization, and load-time optimizations
  * Strong understanding of React/JavaScript frameworks
  * Experience architecting single page applications
  * Experience designing mobile-first web applications
  * Ability to collaborate across multiple teams and be willing to roll up your sleeves and execute!
  * Experience with React Native
  * Working with complex frontend projects with highly interactive features
  * Experience developing with and integrating APIs

 **WHY MEDELY:** BENEFITS & PERKS

\- Competitive Compensation: Based on experience and performance  
\- Long Term Incentives: 401k  
\- Healthcare Benefits: Full suite of benefits including medical, dental, and
vision insurance  
\- Flexibility: We believe that work/life balance is important, so we offer
three weeks of vacation and ten paid holidays  
\- Energetic team environment  
\- Purpose: Join a growing mission-oriented startup that is modernizing the
healthcare industry on a national scale!  
\- Ownership: Drive meaningful business impact on a team that you’ll help
build and define!  
\- Remote: Work in a digital environment with all the tools to achieve your
work as though you were in the office!

 _We're an equal opportunity employer to all. We interview and hire applicants
of all backgrounds, orientations, expressions, and identities._

 _Work location is flexible if approved by Medely, except that position may
not be performed remotely from the state of Colorado._

 _Medely does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. We consider any
resume (CV) or biography received from an agency or outside recruiter without
prior approval from a member of the Medely Human Resources or Recruiting team
to be unsolicited and gratuitous, and such submissions will not be recognized
by Medely for purposes of “ownership” of the candidate._

Senior Web Developer/Engineer - Remote Opportunity

MaxMind (www.maxmind.com) is looking for a talented, experienced, and highly
motivated Senior Web Developer/Engineer to help us develop and improve our
products. We help protect thousands of companies worldwide from fraud,
screening over a billion online transactions each year, and we provide IP
intelligence data to thousands more. As a Senior Web Developer/Engineer, you
will play an important role in improving our existing websites and
applications.

This is a full time remote position, and we welcome candidates to apply from
the following states CA, CO, FL, LA, MN, NV, NY (excluding New York City and
Yonkers), NC, OR, PA, TX, WA, and anywhere in Canada.

MaxMind does not currently sponsor US employment visas. For Canadian
candidates, you must be eligible/authorized to work in Canada.

 **The Position**  
You will be responsible for developing websites and applications. This
includes creating new web applications to help our clients better detect fraud
while also working to improve our existing applications and websites. In doing
this, you will work closely with our product team as well as other engineers.

Our salary range for Senior Web Developer/Engineer roles begins at $140k USD
or $172k CAD (in Canada). See more about benefits and compensation below.

 **Our Development Practices**  
We prefer Bootstrap and vanilla JS for most of our website work, but we
selectively use TypeScript and React when we need to create web applications.
We use Mojolicious on Perl for server side rendering. We also have REST APIs
written in Go. We use PostgreSQL as our database. Our servers run Linux on
Google Cloud Platform.

We maintain high standards for our development practices. All new code is
expected to include automated tests run by TeamCity, and all work goes through
internal code review on GitHub Enterprise.

 **About You - Minimum qualifications**

  * Experience with backend web development. Although we use Mojolicious on Perl as well as Go, we are happy to hear from people with Ruby, Python, modern PHP, or similar experience.

  * Strong knowledge of JavaScript. You should have extensive knowledge of vanilla JS.
  * Experience writing unit and integration tests for both frontend and backend code.
  * Strong knowledge of modern CSS, including using CSS frameworks like Bootstrap as well as CSS preprocessors such as Sass or Less.
  * Experience with responsive web design.
  * Experience writing SQL queries.
  * Experience with revision control, preferably Git.
  * Excellent written and spoken communication skills.
  * The ability to work with a geographically dispersed team.
  * Capable with the command line.

 **Desired, but not required**

It’s also a big plus if you have any of the following:

  * Experience with TypeScript.
  * Experience with at least one modern framework such as React (preferred) or Vue.
  * Working knowledge of graphic design tools such as Sketch, Photoshop, and Illustrator.
  * User interface and experience design skills.
  * Interest in performance and security.
  * Open source contributions.
  * Experience doing code reviews.

 **Why work at MaxMind?**  
In a recent survey, employees listed having a supportive work culture, good
co-workers, autonomy, and feeling trusted, valued, and respected as some of
the things they like most about working here.

MaxMind has a social mission. MaxMind donates over 60% of profits to
charities.

MaxMind’s compensation strives to reward getting stuff done, quality of work,
and working well with others.

Our culture is very important to us. We’re friendly, collaborative, and work-
focused. We don’t like office politics and unnecessary stress. We like to have
productive workdays and don’t like work to chase us when we’re done for the
day. We maintain a set of core, overlapping hours, but are flexible with
specific start and end times and are understanding about appointments and life
events. We care about helping each other succeed.

Our engineering team works remotely so communication centers around video
chat, group chat, and Agile planning tools.

Normally, we hold an annual company summit one time per year in Waltham, MA.

 **Benefits**  
In addition to competitive compensation, our US benefits include medical,
dental, vision, life, and short and long term disability insurance, a Safe
Harbor 401(k) with employer contribution, Health Savings Account, Limited
Purpose Flexible Spending Account, Dependent Care Account, paid parental
leave, and public transit reimbursement.

Our Canadian benefits include medical, dental, vision, life, accidental death
and dismemberment, critical Illness, short and long term disability insurance,
Employee and Family Assistance Program, and paid parental leave. You also have
access to a group Retirement Savings Plan. In lieu of a Canadian RRSP
contribution we provide a bonus payout at the end of each year that employees
may decide to use toward retirement savings.

Everyone participates in a company performance-based bonus plan. MaxMind
offers a $2,000 professional development budget and five days for professional
development annually.

 **Diversity and Inclusion**  
We're committed to diversity and inclusion and are mindful of incorporating
them into all aspects of our company.

We encourage and sincerely welcome applications from candidates of color,
women, queer candidates, candidates with family caregiving responsibilities,
transgender candidates, and from other communities not well represented in the
tech world.

See our complete diversity and inclusion statement.

 _Resumes without cover letters will not be considered. We want to know about
you, please share any projects or accomplishments and include a link so we can
learn more. One of the first steps in our interviewing process is a homework
assignment, and we will ask you for a submission so we can gain insight into
your work._

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on
revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and
for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to
be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history
- from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to
landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a
pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the
way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and
bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what
others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history,
they're making history.

  
Northrop Grumman Defense Systems (NGDS), Beavercreek Ohio, is seeking Full
Stack Web Developers. The successful candidates will demonstrate a broad skill
set balanced between interpersonal and technical capabilities achieving
sustainable quality products. They will have a track record as an effective
communicator and problem solver who is able to develop and maintain good
working relationships with internal and external stakeholders. The selected
candidates will participate in the entire software development lifecycle with
a concentration in software engineering. They will implement solutions in a
web-based environment and integrate them into a microservice cloud-based
architecture.

The candidates will work closely with other software developers accomplishing

 **WHO WE ARE**  
We are Adaptive, a growing and successful software company with a great

technology and practices in the Fintech industry.

 **The Role:**  
Our New York office is looking for a senior Web Developer to deliver a next-
generation all-to-all real time trading platform to serve the North American
institutional market. The platform will be delivered in a greenfield manner
with a modern technology stack throughout. This includes a reactive HTML5
front-end and a clustered, resilient back-end. Adaptive has unique experience
delivering similar platforms and the person in this role will be crucial to
leveraging that internal knowledge and driving the delivery directly in
partnership with the client and their senior management.

As a web applications developer, you will:

  * Build greenfield financial applications alongside your Adaptive colleagues
  * Use the latest technology to create elegant and robust solutions
  * Contribute to building and releasing quality software on time
  * Use your knowledge to build great-looking, event-driven and highly interactive interfaces
  * Collaborate with server-side developers, user-experience designers and business analysts
  * Participate in a test-driven, agile environment
  * Keep up to date with the developments in technology and quickly adapt to them to achieve better results

Required skills and experience:

  * Extensive client-side development experience, gained while building single-page web applications
  * Expertise in JavaScript: you understand prototypical inheritance, scope, and closures
  * Proficiency in user-interface technologies in addition to JavaScript, eg HTML5 and CSS3; and in React.js
  * Practical knowledge of web tooling such as Webpack, NPM, Yarn, Gulp and PostCSS
  * Understanding of ES6 and newer ES specifications
  * Proficient with Chrome developer tools, including knowing how to diagnose and fix performance issues
  * Experience of working on front office systems
  * Language: English (fluent)

Desirable skills and experience:

  * Working with distributed teams
  * TypeScript, Rx.js, Redux
  * Event-driven APIs
  * Real time trading experience

Personal qualities:

  * Strong desire to raise the bar for your team technically
  * Tenacious, curious, and collaborative in all aspects of your work
  * A quick learner with excellent communication skills

In return, we offer:  
Benefits:

  * Medical, dental, and vision
  * 23 days vacation
  * LTD/STD
  * 401K where we match contributions up to 5% of base
  * Gym subsidy
  * FLSA
  * Commuter benefits

bad habits get in the way of using your talents to deliver great results?

**ORGANIZATION**

Endgame360 is a fast-growing digital media company that runs Showbiz Cheat
Sheet, Sportscasting, and MotorBiscuit. A creative organization at its core,
Endgame360's primary goal is to delight its millions of monthly readers with
high-quality content. Relentlessly striving to foster a cycle of success,
Endgame360's mission is to combine data, technology, and storytelling to
inform its on-the-go readers with high quality content. The company's three
core values are teamwork, radical honesty, and innovation. With its positive,
results-oriented, and inclusive culture, Endgame360 has been recognized as an
Inc Magazine Best Workplace in 2020.

Publishing since 2009, the company now has over 130 employees across nearly 30
states and enjoys millions of monthly readers across its four sites.
Endgame360 is well-positioned to continue its growth in content, readers, and
revenues, enabling career advancement and opportunities for current and future
team members.

**LOCATION**

Anywhere in the continental United States as the company operates virtually
across approximately 30 states currently. Endgame360 is headquartered in
Asheville, NC, but has been a remote workforce since inception. Preference may
be given to candidates located in states in which we currently operate: AL,
CA, CO, DC, DE, FL, GA, ID, IL, KY, LA, MA, MD, MI, MO, NC, NJ, NM, NY, OH,
OR, PA, SC, TN, TX, VA, VT, WI, or WV. However, we will not automatically
disqualify those living elsewhere in the United States.

**REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS**

The Fullstack Developer role will report directly to our head of Engineering.

  

**COMPENSATION**

**Base annual salary for this position is $120,000 - $140,000, plus bonus,
based on experience and qualifications.**

Endgame360 offers a competitive compensation and benefits package, including
an exceptional bonus plan, flexible time off program, paid parental leave,
paid family medical leave, health, dental, and vision insurances, 401k with
employer match, a continuing education allowance, flexible spending accounts,
health savings accounts, meet & greets, and financial advising. Endgame360
offers short-term disability insurance fully paid by the company. Endgame360
also offers voluntary long-term disability insurance, voluntary life
insurance, and commuter benefits. In addition, this role will include
participation in a long-term incentive plan.

**EQUAL OPPORTUNITY**

At Endgame360, We Insist That You Be You!

Our audience is made up of readers from many cultures and backgrounds. We
celebrate that our team is no different. Here you have freedom to embrace what
makes you, you: who you love, your gender identity and expression, skin color,
age, appearance, disability, neurodiversity, DNA, military/veteran status,

valued, welcomed, and appreciated here. We are dedicated to providing a
positive workplace and base all employment decisions on your qualifications,
performance, merits, as well as business needs. We are proud to be an Equal

**CONTACT INFORMATION**

If this opportunity interests you and you fit the job description, please

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

_The duties and responsibilities outlined below include essential functions of
the role. Depending on business needs, this role may perform a combination of
some or all of the following duties. Duties, responsibilities, and activities
may change or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice._

As a Fullstack Developer on the team you will:

  * Report directly to our head of Engineering and collaborate with our close-knit technology team.

  * Build the front and back end of leading-edge web applications for high-traffic public facing websites in a Wordpress environment

  * Work with our Product and Marketing teams to define, scope and develop web and mobile web features.

  * Work with our Editorial team to deliver content management tools and UI features.

  * Participate in system and platform architecture, as well as cloud-based infrastructure design and management.

  * Help take our website to the next level.

  * Identify and fix application performance issues.

  * Help mentor and oversee the work of junior developers on the team, and assist in educating non-tech team members on different aspects of technology as needed

  * Effectively communicate technical concepts to a non-technical audience as needed.

  * Quickly research and learn new programming tools and techniques as needed.

  * Assist with code releases where needed, including rolling and testing.

  * Work 100% remotely. Collaborate fluidly and effectively across an all-remote workforce.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

The ideal candidate for the role of Fullstack Developer will have at least 6
years of experience developing web applications and ideally will have
experience working within the Digital Media Industry.

We’re looking to add a **Mid-Level ASP.NET Core MVC Developer** to join our
growing team. At Volano, you will work with a variety of clients and projects
alongside a remarkable team of back-end and front-end developers, designers,
and management to build web and mobile applications.

Volano builds workflow-centric software using the latest proven technologies.
These solutions are created in collaboration with our clients in an agile,
iterative fashion – and typically new from the ground up.

 **Core Functions of this Role**

The people we'll consider for this position must have a thorough understanding
of building and deploying web applications using a variety of tools and
frameworks, such as:

  * ASP.NET MVC
  * C#
  * .NET Core
  * SQL Server
  * Entity Framework/Linq
  * Javascript
  * Knowledge of front-end frameworks (Vue, Angular, React, etc)

 **Essential Responsibilities**

  * Clearly communicate ideas and concepts to clients and internal teams
  * Collaborate with the project team, including project management, front-end developers, UI/UX developers and product design
  * Maintain and improve a variety of web and mobile (hybrid) applications utilizing a variety of technologies with our agile-like approach
  * Curate project backlog and present iteration planning to the client
  * Release updates to staging and production environments through Azure DevOps

 **About Volano Software**

Volano is made up of smart, friendly, creative people who treat each other
like family and who work together to deliver quality custom software to our
clients. We love to be challenged. But we ensure our team members also feel
supported. And we balance getting our work done with not taking ourselves too
seriously.

Volano core values:

  * Learn Constantly
  * Perform to Completion
  * Take Pride in Our Work
  * Adapt Easily
  * Be Fun

 **Benefits and Perks**

We want to make sure we can provide the perks that will make you happy.
Starting with the latest equipment, we want to provide a flexible environment
that makes you the most efficient and effective developer possible. We provide
3 weeks of paid time off and want you to take it – there's nothing that will
kill a good attitude quicker than getting burnt out. We offer a group health
insurance plan through Blue Cross & Blue Shield and a group dental plan
through Principal. Volano pays 100% of both your short-term and long-term
disability plans. We also contribute a match up to 3% to a SIMPLE IRA (upon
qualifying period).

There’s always a variety of La Croix and sodas in the fridge and a pot of good
coffee. We have various company & family outings throughout the year. On
Fridays at 4:00 PM, we shut down the code and turn up the music to play games,
drink libations (or La Croix) and have a good laugh.

 **Work Remotely**

Employees may work from home but need to be near Omaha to attend in-person
meetings and work events.

The AAM Group’s Web Developers and Junior Developers are web-based programmers
working in PHP, JavaScript, and React, that are responsible for helping to
build web-based software that is used by our stakeholders. They work alongside
AAM’s team of programmers to help build and develop our next big idea as well
as helping to maintain existing ones.

 **Who We Are**

AAM is the largest program distribution group in the specialty automotive
aftermarket (TheAAMGroup.com). We provide services for customers of our
wholesale distribution members, which collectively operate nearly 60
warehouses across North America. We reach more than 14,000 resellers of many
types, including 4×4 shops, spray-in bedliner shops, camper top shops, speed
shops, machine shops and engine builders, fleet upfitters, and many other
specialized local automotive shops. Our job at headquarters is to facilitate
purchases for our members and provide marketing tools and services to their
resellers to help them be more successful businesses—ultimately driving more
purchases to our members and the suppliers that support us.

Our fastest-growing offering is Aftermarket Websites®
(AftermarketWebsites.com): a website-building service just for retailers and
installers in the specialty automotive aftermarket. Built BY the industry, FOR
the industry, our sites point consumers searching for products to their local
brick-and-mortar options (i.e., the shops you’ll be designing websites for).
This robust, e-commerce–ready platform lets shop owners upload product
information, including pricing, to reach consumers searching for the products
they sell. Aftermarket Websites® currently hosts more than 100 websites, and
we are adding more every month.

We’re on a mission to build the best websites for the best price for our
stores. We are a hardworking, close-knit team, and nobody in the automotive
aftermarket industry does what we do as well as we do it. For more information
about who we are, check out our organization’s most recent presentation book:
TheAAMGroup.com/partners.

**The IDEAL Candidate**

You are highly creative, passionate about web development, detail-oriented,
and can follow directions well. An important part of this position involves
cultivating a deep understanding of our website platforms (don’t worry, we’ll
teach you!) to be able to build and fine-tune our software for the betterment
of our customers. We need good developers that can write clean code, learn
from their mistakes, and understand the best outcomes for our customers to
ensure we keep improving. Programmers can never stop learning. There is always
new technologies and better ways to do something than the last time you did.

Also, because most people in an office environment are not techies or
typically as qualified on computers as most programmers are, from time-to-time
help fix office-related computer problems and help to implement best practices
with IT.

Last, the ideal candidate is fun, respectful, kind, and does their job without
needing to be micro-managed. We don’t want to hover any more than you want us
hovering, but you’ll receive support whenever you need it.

**This is NOT a remote position** —we want the pleasure of your company in the
office!

**Job Duties**

  * Build, develop, and create new software that meets expectations and is delivered on time.

  * Ensure that created software is well tested and functions as intended when used by others.

  * Maintain/update existing tools and software with new features and improvements.

  * Help to maintain AAM’s hardware in the office – Desk computers, laptops, servers, and all other equipment.

  * General Office IT – Work with AAM staff to help manage, install, and update computers throughout the office.

  * Participate in regular code reviews to help you learn and enhance your coding skills.

 **Skill Requirements**

  * Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science

  * Excellent computer skills

  * Basic/Moderate understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript (ES6), React, and PHP

  * Capable of developing Object-Oriented PHP software

  * Firm knowledge of building SQL queries (MySQL) and working with complex database structures

  * Experience with Git Hub/Git

  * Understanding of TypeScript, SCSS, Docker, and Webpack and added plus.

  * Must have experience developing in MVC Framework. CodeIgniter 2/3/4 or Laravel is an added plus.

  * Must be able to gather requirements, build code, and work independently as well as work jointly with the team.

  * Must take pride in paying attention to the details.

  * Must have problem-solving mentality and the ability to weigh the priorities of various work demands.

  * Must be focused and self-motivated.

  * Must have strong verbal & written communication skills

  * Must be able to work from our Piney Flats office. No remote or offsite work offered.

REP does more than engineer the most innovative home gym equipment… we help
people hit PR’s, find their strength, and bring the gym home. What started
with two brothers in a garage selling kettlebells has grown into a globally
expanding business with over 100+ employees committed to a shared passion for
fitness. A career at REP demands creativity, ambition and offers the
opportunity to grow with some of the best athletes, teammates, and partners in
the industry.

REP Fitness is seeking a full-stack Shopify developer/engineer to join our
eCommerce team to head the in-house development of RepFitness.com. This role
will lead the optimization of our website experience and build new features
and functionality with a customer-obsessed focus to help scale DTC growth.

This position reports directly to the Director of Marketing/ E-Commerce

  * Work with the eCommerce team to identify and realize short-, medium-, and long-term website goals and help define the future vision for the REP Fitness digital experience.

  * Build and modify Shopify 2.0 themes and templates to realize a mobile-first, conversion-optimized site married with a lifestyle brand experience.

  * Experience with Shopify
